text: Kimchee jigae is one of the best I've had in my life having lived in Seoul for a year. Very high quality and fresh ingredients.
Good food. Plenty of sides. Excellent service. I liked the seating area in the center.
This place so good !! I am Korean and barely go eat Korean food but love this place a lot. Best Korean traditional food!!!!!!!

Great Korean quality food ! Best service from Ji Hoon and Min Ji super nice, and soo attentive!!! They made our dinner more special! We will be going back very soon !!! I recommend this place truly!!!
Great food fantastic service will come here again the strawberry mochi is really good my parents loved the meat the shrimp tastes amazing
First time here and I can honestly say the food here is amazing. So many sides to choose from and quality of meat is incomparable to anywhere else.
Delicious food and sides. Fair prices. They even cooked my food for me. Will come back again.
Atmosphere is not too fancy but still classy. Service was top notch. And the food did not disappoint. Food came out quickly and was delicious.
First time eating Korean  BBQ here in Las Vegas and it was really good! Service was great very friendly!! We got our food quickly and the staff was attentive. We will be coming back!
Amazing food and service. The meats are amazing and the best side dishes ever. The meal comes with so many sides it is difficult to finish! Price is very reasonable.

We are visiting Las Vegas and wanted to have lunch away from the busy strip, so we googled "best places to eat in Vegas" and this was part of the 25 hottest places to eat in Vegas and so we went....we  ordered the beef platter and...... it makes you not want to go to any other Korean BBQ place but this one....that says a lot considering that we live in Los Angeles and we are surrounded by Korean BBQ places in every city around LA....quality of the food and meat is excellent and the service and atmosphere is top notch and if you do decode to visit this place don't forget to try the mochi my wife says its the best she's ever tasted....this place also offers an authentic Korean restaurant feel ( the effect of sitting on a low table) and its not to far from the Las Vegas strip (about 10-15 mins away)..... Would highly recommend.

This place is as good as Korean BBQ gets.  The interior is very unique and you can tell they paid a lot of attention into small details.   Quality of meat is fresh and delicious.  Servers were friendly and attentive.  
I would definitely go back there.

My family and I just left this restaurant. We ordered a combination platter and it was pretty for all of us. Lots of variety was available. The neat could've been more seasoned and the waiter could've provided more of a detailed explanation of the menu as its fairly confusing. All in all, it was ok.

This is a very good Korean BBQ restaurant. Came for the second time. My son loves the beef tongue here so much so we are back again for it. Beef brisket is also good. All of the fresh meat tastes juicy. Try this out it's a good place to eat meat.

Finally, we have best KBBQ in Las Vegas. The meat quality is top notch. The beef melts in your mouth. This was one of the most satisfying KBBQ dining experiences I've ever had. Great atmosphere, great service, great food. I like their soothing music. I will try their lunch menu with my friends next week.

First time here.  Recommend by our friends.  First impression is spacious dinning room and clean.  The foods are very good. Specially the beefs are good quality.  The service are so good and very friendly staffs.  Highly recommend.  We will come back for sure.
Meat quality was pretty decent. However, the service was really slow, which I understand since it's a relatively new restaurant.
Tried Goong for the first time and was really impressed. The ambiance is really nice and relaxing. The quality of the meat is excellent and would definitely come back.

Five stars across the board: service was great, ambiance and decor is very nice, and most importantly, the food was amazing.  Hands down THE BEST Korean BBQ place in Vegas.  Definitely recommend Goong if you want Korean BBQ in Vegas. Great place for families and large groups. Looking forward to going again with my friends very soon!!!

What an amazing experience! We came for lunch and the servers were so attentive. We ordered the beef "platter" and it was so delicious. There were so many sides that came with our meal, you could ALMOST get full off those. The interior is beautiful and you could choose to sit at a regular table or go authentic and take your shoes off in one of their Korean-style tables, just make sure to pick the side with the backing! We'll be returning soon!
Best Korean BBQ I have ever tried. My family said it was also amazing. We love this place and are definitely coming back again.

Suppose to be good came last night w/ a friend  it's more pricey than normal Korean BBQ place. It's okay food. First thing we order for 2-3 people  all beef so when it served  I started cooking then the waiter came back and said i told u to wait    He wanted to be the one cooking .. I'm like ummm isn't this cook your own !?!  So he keeps coming back and putting  the meat.. I felt uncomfortable coz I feel he comes more than actual enjoying  the food and cooking.. the meat it maybe high quality of meat but who cares if u don't even enjoy it much.. besides if I wanted someone to cook ill go to regular restaurant .. 

Overall I won't go back unless got invited by a friend ..   they should just let their costumer do their thing  or ask them if they would like help them cook ..     


   Not for me sorry

Love love love this Korean bbq!!! Having been to Seoul 3 times, I've tried authentic Korean bbq and Goong doesn't fall short! The food is amazing, the staff is friendly, welcoming and very helpful! Thank you Goong Korean Bbq!

We had the beef tongue, the wagu chuck flat and the marinated prime short rib, all the meat and the different accompaniments were delicious! We also had the Black raspberry wine, which goes very well with meat)))

The food was awesome but the service here was terrible. Our party was pretty slow with trying to figure out how to go about things like ordering and cooking since it was our first time here. At first the servers were great and friendly with helping us but then after putting the first selection of meat for us it went south. We tried to cook the first plate that came out since we were told by another server to finish so they can bring another plate out. So we tried to cook the meat but then another server was noticeably pissy  by our placement of the meat not being on the center of the grill which we didn't know it was a no-no. We've been to AYCE KBBQ places together before so we're used to just placing it wherever but there are just things you can say in a different tone to not show how peeved you are. Then we got the other plate and another server has to comment on us to move faster. By the time we finished we waited for the longest time, about over 45 minutes for our bill to come. This is after we helped the runner clean our table completely and it was the runner that I had to ask for the bill from or else we would've never gotten it. So much for helping and rushing us.
This is a very great korean bbq. Have very good meat. My family the pork and beef combination and it was very great. I would definitely recommend this to others.

Overall food quality is amazing! The meat we had so juicy and loved it 
Interior is very luxury, if i have a important guest to treat, I would bring them here for kbbq than any other cheap ayce kbbq.
Wow! That was better than expected. Will definitely come back. Beef ans pork dishes were amazing. Cooking time great! Thanks!

As a Korean, I can say this is the Best Korean restaurant in town, esp if your looking for traditional cuisine, not the trendy BBQ places that play dance music and K-Pop. They even have traditional seating wear you have to take off your shoes. This is a high-end restaurant with humble offerings at reasonable prices. Especially for lunch. Service is great and staff is super friendly.
We had the wagyu platter and it was the best! Place was nice and clean. Server was really friendly. Will definitely come back again.
The best quality of red meat! I love it here and I will be back and bring some friends and family here. I love everything there! You guys are the best! Thank you for great food and service.
Great food. The server described each dish.Awesome customer service. Very friendly. They greet you at the door.

We got the combo portion for 4-5 people, it was good. It came with multiple sides, rice, soup, and salad. The staff cooked the food for us. If you post a review, you get a free ice cream or soda. Good food, portion and service. We sat at the booth where we had to take out shoes off.

Came here with one other person. Wagyu beef was excellent quality. The service was very fast. We were never left waiting for food, and the servers also assisted in cooking our meat while we were eating. Recommended to try!

This is my favorite Korean BBQ in Las Vegas. 5 stars easily. Great service, great environment and of course great food! You can not go wrong with anything on the menu. If this is the first time at a KBBQ place just ask the servers for the most popular dishes and they will gladly assist you. This is how I got started and I never turned back after :)
Best place for Korean food and the service is also fabulous. Ordered boneless Kalbi and Bulgogi. The meats where tender and juicy. I really recommend this place to eat for great Korean food.
The staff has been very attentive and the food is delicious! The entree came with several sides so I got to try a lot of new things I probably wouldn't have been brave enough to order separately.

This restaurant is better than the ones in LA!!!  Lots of ban chan.  Good bbq, we had beef and pork bulgogi.  Both really good, I never eat the pork bbq, but I think it was better than the beef.  Really nice place and the staff are really nice and attentive.  Found my new favorite spot!

We thought this restaurant looked great aesthetically, but after waiting 5 min to be seated (per their sign) and then waiting another 10 minutes to order I walked out of the restaurant. Two people who were seated across and sat down way after us got to order their food from someone we didn't even know was a waiter. (This supposed waiter gave us a complimentary beverage and that's it. This employee saw us waiting for a waiter and did nothing). That's when we walked out of the restaurant. I don't know if they were short staffed or what? Unprofessional!!!!!!!! I really wanted Korean food too. Never returning here. I'll stick with Sura, Honey pig and Gen instead. So for lunch we went to Omoide which is across from them and received professional and attentive service.

Wow so much side dishes and such fresh beef!  Enjoyed our meal and would recommend! My favorite was the top sirloin and for the side I liked the side egg and tofu soup. The wait staff cooks for you if they aren't too busy but you have the choice to cook your own if you like.

It's really traditional korean restaurant. We love it a lot! The food here us very fresh and tasty! We specially like the beef and pork combination platter~ The people here are really kind and friendly. We will definitely come here again for sure :)
First time here and this place is now my go to Korean place! Food was really good! Love all their meats and love the ambiance too! Will definitely come back. The pork jowl was soo good too!
went with the wagyu platter (says for 2-3 person, in reality it's for 4...lol) ! well worth the price! our host "Moon" took really care of us! very attentive!
it's the best Korean BBQ I 've seen. I really like the handmade peach soju here. I would come back here to try this restaurant

I used love this place,love the meat they service, but last time I invite my friend together, the service was very bad, we sat inside the room, we ordered 6 beer, but no-one help us open the bottle, my husband try to open himself by scissors, his finger got cut and bleed lot,but until we almost finished our meal, no one serve us with napkins, I had went outside to ask.  The bill is about $400, I was charged 18% Tip Automatic, I do not care for the money, but I do not like the way they take care the custom.
Great date night. Took my gf here for her first time and she Loved it. The service was great, thanks Jihoon! Food is even better,  won't be disappointed. Can't wait to come back!!
Amazing food. They have awesome steamed egg, potato noodles, and sooo much good meat! Definitely come here when you can because they have amazing food!

I absolutely loved my experience from here. Super great customer service where they cook the food for you, such great decoration and best of all excellent food quality. 
   I have been to many kbbq places and never been so satisfied with their food quality like over here.
   Over all excellent but only down thing is it's a little too pricey with a small portions. Oh well! As long as the tummy is happy isn't it:)

Been here a couple times and the quality of the meat hasn't changed from day 1. The servers are friendly and attentive. Meat is sliced to order which makes it better than the rest. You can see the beautiful marbling on every type of meat they cook for you at your table. The name Goong means palace in korean and that's exactly what the interior of the restaurant looks like! The name speaks for itself! Also, the manager always stops by to check on us which is a huge plus!
The food was delicious !!! And the service was also great..thanks to my waiters Jihoon and HS Kim...
Servers dont know what to do for customers. Costumer have to wait for eye-contact to order more. Bad service and okay food for price you pay.  bbq restaurant server training boot camp!!!

Best quality of meat I've ever eaten in a Korean restaurant. Excellent. Definitely try the Wagyu ribeye. The kalbi was perfectly marinated. The banchan selection was wide and delicious. The ambience was very relaxing. This is my new favorite Korean spot!
The food was wonderful and Connie, our server was wonderful! It's always a great place to have dinner and try new things.
By far the best Korean BBQ i have tried, i love the service, the ambiance, and the friendly servers

What an amazing dinning experience! The ambience is very appealing and my seven year old daughter loved sitting on the cushions and taking off her shoes to dine. When it comes to the food, the meat is fresh and the sides are delicious!

ONCE soon a time I went here the food needed to be a little more cooked and the tables a little bit bigger like I was having cloister phobia in this damn place I was not having it but it was ok I guess
This is my favorite local Korean restaurant and go to area for dinner or lunch near me.  I enjoy the soups and the entrees here.  It's is good Korean food you can enjoy and rely on.
I had never had Korean Bbq before. It was amazing and Connie our waitress was so much help. Love the atmosphere here.
Best Korean food I've had in Las Vegas! Definitely recommend. The bulgogi, brisket and dak bulgogi are amazing.

Goong is one of the better korean bbq in Las Vegas. Their bulgogi and galbi is marinated just right! For stews, try the denjang jjiagae (bean paste stew) kimchi jjigae is the only thing I don't recommend on the menu .

Great place for Korean bbq. Lots of great side dishes, bottles of wine are really reasonable in price. Fun experience and food service. It can get a little hot there (probably because of al the grills going), but overall great place.
Best Korean bbq in town!! Excellent service too! My wife and I have been there at least 10 times!

I have been to this restaurant 4 times. The first time I was so impressed I couldn't wait to return. They changed the type of grill depending on the fat content of the beef.  They also "introduced " the various cuts of meat.  Like many restaurants, it seems like once they get established when they are new, the quality and service start to wane.  My most recent visit was last week.  The server was rushed, the grill was never changed, and the quality of the food was average. My family and I will not be returning.  It actually saddens me.  I am a big fan of Korean BBQ, and I thought I had found a good quality restaurant close to my house.

Several months earlier, my department head at work brought me and a couple coworkers to Goong over lunch, and I remember the food here was awesome, so I decided to take my wife here. The place is very clean, and well designed around Korean culture. In the center of the restaurant, they have tables raised just off the floor. We were seated on the outer edge, at the tables for 4, and these are placed at normal height (for Americans). They played american music, and the young Korean staff could be heard singing along quietly from our table. They were in very good spirits. My wife and I ordered the marinated beef, chicken, and pork dinner for two. I also ordered a Hite beer, and they brought out a large bottle of beer, which was like 22 ounces I think. My wife ordered the Korean raspberry wine, of which she gave me a taste, and was delicious. They brought out several sides, among which were Korean glass noodles, to dried radish, and kimchi (which I love), seafood soup, mixed veggies (with its own dipping sauce that was sweet and hot) and dipping sauces for the meats, and a few others that I can't remember the names of. Your table gets literally full of little side dishes. And you're picking off these while the meat is cooking. The staff cooks the meat for you, (probably for health code reasons) so they are frequently at your table. They cook the meats on a grill that comes up through the center of your table. They even change the grill halfway through the dinner so we had a fresh one when they started the chicken. The service was above expectations, and we were never wondering where a person is if we needed anything. The food itself was absolutely phenomenal. They nailed the marinades on each of the meats. The sides were all delicious as well, even though we both had our favorites. At the very end of the meal, they brought out two cinnamon teas in tiny little cups. Just enough to taste, but not too much because you are so full from the meal that you can't drink the whole thing, which you will be. There was so much meat that by the time we got to the last pork protein, we could not eat another bite. The staff reassured us that this is normal, and boxed up the remaining items. The price was just over $90 for my wife and me, and honestly I expected it to be more considering the sheer volume of food we got. I remember we were saying that we could have easily had brought two more people with us to eat everything that they brought out. I would rate this among the most exceptional dining experiences we've had in the Vegas valley, and we will definitely be going again.
Authentic Korean Barbecue with high quality meat. Great service with amazing atmosphere. Will recommend it to anyone.
I love this place! First time trying Korean BBQ and it is my go to! My boyfriend and I always order the calbi and kimjijie! Our server Eun Sung was awesome as well as everyone else!

Goong is our go-to neighborhood meatfest. Consistently serving quality cuts, Goong always does it for us. Since opening we have been here 5 times and service is always top notch, which I can't say  is always the case at Korean BBQ joints. Do yourself a favor and check them out.
Love this place! Great atmosphere and food and tons of variety! Our server was also very nice!
We come nearly every month and it's been amazing every time. The wagyu beef is the best!
Love coming here for the amazing meat selection. Always great staff, welcoming for families. Fun relaxed environment.

This place is trash, the service is awful, the meat isn't good, the overall experience is just poor, I'm embarrassed I spent my money and time here. I wouldn't recommend this place to my worse enemy, I would rather make the drive down to Chinatown and spend more money then come here again.
Came twice in 3 days. Great service and quality food. Had the dol sit bibimbab and galbi tang the first night and did the beef platter the second night. Everything was good.

My new favorite Korean restaurant. In the midst of these AYCE kbbqs this restaurant really stands out. The service was perfect.. Attentive but not intrusive.. They cook for you so you can really enjoy your meal. The meat quality is just so much better than the AYCE places and the side dishes or ( banchan) were delicious authentic and plentiful. First time we got the beef set for the three of us ( it's recommended for 2-3 people but the portion is quite large. There was a variety of meats including prime ribeye and filet mignon. Also included was a choice of soup .. Kimchi, bean paste or soft tofu. I've tried them all and all are delicious. You also get a steamed egg. I like how you don't have to stuff yourself because you can take home leftovers ( unlike AYCE ) I tend to totally overeat at those establishments thinking I have to get my money's worth. The food and service made my experiences here so much more enjoyable. Hope they keep up the quality. I will be a regular here I'm sure.
The food was fine, but the iced green tea and the chai tea at the end were fabulous.  Worth sitting through a lunch with music blasting and slow service.

SETTING: They have the low table seating for those who want the traditional seating, booths for normal seating, and even small private areas. This place is really big and spacious so you never have to wait for a table:) The waiters kindly cook the food for you at the table.

DRINKS: They serve iced rice tea to their customers. It's hard to drink if you're not used to it. They have a full drink menu with beer, wine, shoju, and more.

DINING: Their portions are a little smaller than other restaurants and they do not have all you can eat. Their meat is very low quality and very tough to chew. They serve everything with the small Korean side dishes. I like this place because they give a lot of side dishes.Their menu is pretty full with all your favorite Korean bbq dishes so everyone is sure to have something they will enjoy. Super excited that this place has the short rib and dikon soup because it is a rare dish to find. Everything is honestly over-priced here.

DESSERTS: mochi mochi mochi!!!

Great service, friendly and great quality meat. 
I would recommend the Prime boneless short rib. I like when the meat is tender and juicy. It was perfect!
I would definitely come back!

Loved the whole experience here! Absolutely delicious and our server, Kyle, topped it off with his superb service. Very clean and no roaring EDM music (win!). For anyone contemplating on checking this place out - do it! You will not regret it. We will be back for sure!

Easily became my favorite KBBQ in town. It's reasonably priced and offers much better meat quality.The banchan is varied and bountiful:) I enjoyed all the meats, and I did feel like you're paying for better quality.
I also love the traditional interior.
It's not right next to the strip, but definitely worth it!

this resturant is aesthetically pleasing and the food is amazing. i ordered the thinly sliced brisket,wagyu ribeye and kim chi jiigae. The quality of meat is definitely one of the best i've ordered at any korean BBQ place here in Las Vegas. although they dont offer AYCE, there's date night- family sized orders. I would recommend to come in and try it for yourself. SHOUTOUT to my waitress for teaching me how to eat ribeye properly.
The food and service was excellent! The beef was steakhouse quality and the service was definitely top notch..
Food was fresh, tasty and consistent from one item to the next.  Service friendly.  Very clean.  Will definitely come back.
This is an amazing restaurant, the service is fast and the waitress are friendly and kind. They have a section without shoes 100% Korean.

I really didnt like it. The people are nice and all, the place itself is very nice. But the way they cook the meat, its just that I've been to many many korean bbq places already and its hard when you're cooking an dthen all of a sudden they'll butt in and grab the thing so they can flip the meat. Its just that im not used to this kind and its pricey too. They have good side dishes tho. The salad is yummy, i love the raddish. Its just the meat isnt enough and they keep coming back and fourth on our table and just flipping the meat while we were cooking. But over all, i guess its a fine restaurant. Good quality of meat too. :)

We definitely did not expect the ambiance in this restaurant. Very classy and modern. The plating definitely added to the restaurants theme using all black ceramic and clay pots. The service was great and patient with me trying to pronounce everything. The food was delicious so this is my new Korean BBQ spot.

Love the stone pot bim bim bop and fried rice. My son got the wrap, and he said "it was good."

My husband got a cold bim bim bop. Had raw meat. I've actually never seen that type before until today.

At the end of the meal, they give you a cold cinnamon tea which is awesome! It was love at first taste...

This place is straight up bangin!

Went here during my honeymoon and the food was so good it legit made me cry.  It doesn't even matter what you get; its all awesome.

Highly recommend!
Best service in the area! My mom and I shared the Beef Combo for two, great value. Good quality meat and sides dishes. Highly recommended!!

I'm always shocked to find a great restaurant that is virtually empty at dinner.  But, such is Las Vegas in December on a Tuesday.

First, the meat.  Three of us shared the beef platter, a series of 5 increasingly fatty, non-marinated cuts followed by Bulgogi.  Between the staff cooking the meat and you taking pieces when they're done to your liking, it works really well.  The first 5 cuts need some seasoning post-cook and you can choose from two flavored salts or a soy-based dipping sauce.  The quality of the beef was outstanding.

Second, the sides.  There's about a dozen or so little dishes that come with the platter and they're really, really good, and you can ask for seconds (maybe more) on the ones you like best. Great variety - kimchi, noodles, two salads, raw vegetables, pickled vegetables, radish and a bunch of others that were hard to figure out exactly what they were other than delicious.  Also with the beef platter comes a choice of soup - we got tofu and it was great - and four small pancakes that they cook prior to the beef.  

All together, the beef platter for 2-3 with the sides and the soup could easily serve 4 adults.

The staff are very helpful and attentive and the interior is clean and mid-2000 modern.  Overall, a great dining experience and a fantastic Korean BBQ joint.
Went here for the 1st time a few weeks ago and enjoyed everything. Great service, the meat was soft, cooked easily. Their green tea ice cream and mochi were to die for!! I'm coming back for sure
Second time here. Ordered a lunch special soup, the portion is big. Their beef tongue is very tasted. We also ordered the pork neck and rib eye prime. Really good Korean bbq. Will be back again.
Side dishes and meat was great.  Service on New Year Day was just ok.  We shared the beef combo between three people and we were all full.
Great korean place in Vegas! super fancy and meet is high quality

This is the best Korean establishment I've been to this far in Vegas hands down! Food is on point and tasty. The cinnamon tea at the end is the finishing touch to this amazing meal! Definitely coming back here.

Came here with a friend on a Monday evening, easy to find, off of Rainbow and Robindale, behind Dairy Queen. New place i heard about recently like another on Spring Mtn. 

Decor is amazing and quite different from any other KBBQ place in town. Very clean and open. I noticed they had those "floor seats" where you have to take off your shoes and put your legs in a hole areas for larger groups. Nice quiet ambiance. "Older style" hoods up in the air causing the smoke to NOT go in and get exhausted (rip) 

Service was pretty immediate and friendly. Very attentive and they cook for you as well. 

My friend wanted the pork platter so we had ordered that

Pork Platter ($42 - Good for 2-3 people) - Consists of Pork Belly, Pork Jowl, Marinated Pork Outside Skirt, and Spicy Marinated Thinly Sliced Pork

Combination platters come with steamed egg and a choice of soup (kimchi, doenjang [bean paste], or soft tofu) 

Other combinations they have are

Beef Platter ($65 - Good for 2-3 people) - Consists of Prime Rib Eye, Wagyu Top Sirloin, Prime Chuck Flat, Prime Flat Iron, Thinly Sliced Prime Brisket, Marinated Thinly Sliced Ribeye

Beef & Pork Platter ($85 - Good for 4-5 people) Consists of Prime Rib Eye, Wagyu Top Sirloin, Prime Chuck Flat, Thinly Sliced Prime Brisket, Pork Belly, Spicy Marinated Thinly Sliced Pork, Marinated Thinly Sliced Rib Eye

Goong Special ($145 - Good for 4-5 people) Consists of Wagyu Rib Eye, Wagyu Top Sirloin, Prime Boneless Short Rib, Wagyu Chuck Flat, Prime Flat Iron, Pork Belly, Pork Jowl, Marinated Prime Short Ribs, Black Tiger Shrimp

They do have individual options too to order (BBQ, Marinated BBQ, various entrees, 

First of all. TONS OF SIDE DISHES ! We were two people in a booth, we almost had our entire table covered in side dishes and what not. Didn't even have our own individual plate/bowl for eating. Lol xD Sliced pickled daikon, potato salad, onion salad in light sauce, jap chae, fish cake, romaine sesame oil dressed salad, black beans, spicy raw octopus, kimchi, chives, iceburg lettuce salad, and a plate of seaweed, carrot and cucumber sticks with a small bowl of gochujang. Each person also gets a dish of green tea salt and normal salt and pepper, and a dish of sauce

Like another place in town, i believe they have their own butchering to provide such a vast variety of meats AND be able to serve raw beef (one of their dishes consisting of julienned raw beef marinated with salt, garlic and sesame oil - needs to be super fresh meat to do this)

------------------------------------------
they have different grills for different meats. Pork tends to be the flat metal plate vs Beef being a more open grate 

Pork belly and pork jowl came out first and was cooked first. Service was very attentive that neither side were burnt and was flipped constantly. Pork especially with lots of fat tends to burn fast later on but none were. Beautifully cooked. Tender and juicy. 

Marinated Pork Outside Skirt was nicely done. Not overly flavorful. Fairly light. Tender and juicy. Awkward various sizes on some pieces but im not too picky about that. 

Spicy Marinated Thinly Sliced Pork is like the normal spicy pork but sliced thinner. Cooked fairly fast too. 

-----------------------------------------
Service was very attentive. It was a slow night. If they can keep this up even when they are busy, that would be amazing

I did notice as we were leaving that one of the waiters were up and cleaning the hoods. I noticed how clean the bottom of the grill was prior to cooking. Maybe they clean each individual one after use? Would be nice if they cook uphold that AND keep it going. 

Definitely would come back to try the beef.
The best Korean BBQ I haven't eat before , I love the design of the table , nice service ~~
Fantastic Korean bbq with an excellent staff making for a great dining experience! Beats anything near the strip and will be a guaranteed stop for me every trip to Vegas!!!
Great atmosphere, great quality food. We had the beef platter and were impressed! Service was great also. We will be back!

Huge space.. EXCELLENT service.  But there are so many Korean BBQ in town that this place just doesn't really exceed their competitions.  There are many varieties of the side dish but none of them was really memorable. I would recommend this place if you want a quick lunch and lots of side plates but I wouldn't recommend it if you're looking for bold and different flavors

The food here is delicious. It's very clean and the customer service is absolutely amazing. The food taste great and they have really good deals despite not being an all you can eat restaurant. Will come back for sure.

So it's my first time here and the service is amazing. Great change of pace when sitting down, you have to take off your shoes and relax which is great after a long day of house hunting.  I have been to many Korean BBQ places in Las Vegas and this is by far one of the best.
Great place and quality meat. My wife and I always get the wagyu platter and you really can't go wrong.  Special pricing in their wine bottles and the staffs are great. Highly recommended.

We went here randomly because we did not want to drive to hobak. I had come when they first opened for lunch and it was great. 

I was hesitant to go for dinner because the prices were high but I knew their meat was of superior quality. My boyfriend and I were extremely pleased more than we expected. The large amount of sides immediately made me happy. Their staff was very attentive and nice (which is not common for Asian restaurants) The staff cooked our meats according to our preferences and changed our grill when necessary. The grill heats up super fast too. (I am a bit impatient during grill changes but this was not a concern). I also liked the fact that I got to chose the type of soup we wanted. I love tofu soup and it was probably one of the most flavorful broth that I have ever had in Las Vegas. 

I cannot say that they are better than Hobak because the experience was entirely different but both places are great.  (I might like this place better). It is very clean and welcoming, there are different areas depending on your group size and it is very well ventilated. We might have left smelling a little like kbbq but honestly, we could go out after leaving and people wouldn't know. I love this place.
I've been to a lot of Korean Bbq restaurants here in Las Vegas, but this by far is the best spot in the south area. Both service and food were great!!! I'll definitely come back!!
This place is the bomb especially good for friends. The more people the better. This will be my first stop in Vegas

Nice ambience. Love the modern classy decor. By far the nicest Korean BBQ place we have been to in Vegas. Friendly & attentive staff, that cooks the meat for tourists. Good quality meat & sides and portions are good too. Although it's not ayce you still get a bang for your buck.

Tried a nearby Korean BBQ that was WAY too loud. Goong was just down the block, and what a difference! Large space, large tables, intimate... and we could hold a conversation without anyone else hearing. Food and service were fabulous! Loved taking off the shoes and feeling at home. We entered into a very unique space, and thankful to have found this amazing restaurant in our community!

Been at this place couple times and every time still like the first time. Meat quality is perfect! even without marinated. You had my 5* but your server messed up!!!! 

Ordered a bottle of soju me both me and cousin, I.D. check! of course no complain on that. I'm 22 and my cousin is 28. The server looked at my I.D. and gave it back, then looked at my cousin's then surprisingly asked him " You're older than him( who is me )?!?!? ". Deep down in my heart, I died a little bit :( only a bottle of soju you dont have to make me feel that way :(( . 

Just a funny story I wanna share but love this place, will always come back.

I was very impressed with this restaurant.  I have a go-to Korean BBQ spot and this one was right up to par with my go-to spot.  I will definitely be coming back.  The meat was so fresh and juicy.  They provide you with a variety of sides.

I love Korean BBQ and this place definitely reminds me why. Everything tastes amazing especially their Kimchi fried rice, Bulgogi, and Short ribs. The side dishes are delicious too! Not only is the food great but the restaurant itself is so cute I like the ambiance. Great place to eat!

Meat quality good. Poor/inattentive service from management and other staff. Our server David was really nice however. He was doing a great job. Took an hour for us to get our first serving of meat... And for the  high price, we barely got enough meat to eat. Do yourself a favor and try Hobak or Gen instead.

First time! I visited LV to see my cousins and they took me here. I got surprised because they do shoes off at KBBQ! I never seen kind like that before! I think it's really cool! :) those beef palette are really good and amazon quality! Totally double thumbs up and I will definitely come here again when I come visit LV!

I'm usually a fan of the all you can eat ordeal, but decided to give the   al carte thing a chance, and it was great. Still feel full and great about myself after the Goong special with my family of 5. The meats had a lot of flavor, and the atmosphere and music made for a pleasant experience. Can definitely see myself coming back.

This place is soooooo goooood!!!! The atmosphere is so eccentric and cool!! By far one of the best Korean bbq restaurants in Las Vegas. I would definitely recommend eating here even if you haven't tried Koran bbq before. 5 stars

Glad a new Korean bbq open, I like that this one is not all you can eat which means the meat quality is much better . The meat was very tender . The seating is very cute traditional . I'll defiantly be coming here weekly .

First impression was that the place is very nice and big and very clean. We were greeted and seated right away. We received exceptional service. Everything was tasty and there were lots of side dishes and There was nothing that I did not like. Will definitely come back here again!

Got the 85 dollar Wagyu Platter with 2 friends and we were stuffed. Our server Jun, was something else, he not only gave us good service but was also very humorous making our dinner that much more enjoyable!

Interior design and updated menu is just beautiful!
Back at Goong for Easter Sunday dinner. Got seated right away. We got the beef and pork combo $85.

This place is amazing

The food 5 star
Interior 5 star
Staff/service 5 star

I went to most of korean bbq restaurant in town

But i can say that GOONG is the best 
In las vegas

The quality of the meat is amazing
You'll never try this kind of meat in any restaurant in town 

Maybe  in the west coast

Must try!!!!!

I'm a little nervous about this place becoming too popular, but this is truly the best Korean BBQ in Vegas. They bring out the most side dishes and the highest quality of meat. Everyone I know ends up coming here multiple times per week.

This is our favorite date night outing. It is near our home, I love Korean BBQ, and it is a classy place with wonderful service. The restaurant is spacious, clean and boasts a modern design infused with traditional Korean decorative touches. This is NOT cheap or a place akin to AYCE joints, so I would not recommend if you are on a budget. Another complaint I saw was that the servers are "overly involved" in terms of cooking the meat. I appreciate that because it alleviates the smoke, improperly cooked meat, oh-crap moments where they have to run over to a table and douse it in water. It makes for a relaxing, semi interactive experience. 
They have an extensive beverage menu and we always opt for Chum Chubum Soju because I love anything that tastes like peach. It is reasonably priced at $12 for a bottle and it is more than enough between the two of us.
We opt for the Beef Combination Platter ($65) which includes prime rib eye, wagyu top sirloin, prime chuck flat, prime flat iron, thinly sliced prime brisket and marinated thinly sliced rib eye. The banchan is pretty standard consisting of kimchi, spicy radish, soybean sprout, Oi Muchim (spicy cucumber salad), watercress namul, fried tofu, etc. One most certainly gets their money's worth, but make sure to come hungry!
I have always found the service to be consistent, courteous and accommodating. I also don't mind the extra hand in helping cook my meat to perfection.
Awful service. Food never came until asked, we had to cook our own dinner. Food used to be ok now plain super market quality. Never again.

Great atmosphere to eat it. I love the seating style, the service was good. The food was also good, definitely not the best Korean BBQ place I've been to but I love this restaurant, good food in Las Vegas is pretty hard to find in my opinion and this is my new go-to restaurant whenever I'm in Vegas again. Well done!

Let's see high reviews again and I jump on any new Korean restaurant so of course I had to come here. After having really good Korean food in LA I promised to never eat Korean in Vegas so I don't get disappointed. But this place has pretty good quality in comparison to other Korean restaurants in Vegas. 

First of all my hubby and I came here and we're the only customers. Later 3 tables got filled up but service was pretty good at first. 

Ok who goes to Korean BBQ for the salad? But really I appreciate a good salad with my food. They brought us two salads. One is excellent and I got many refills. One I didn't touch which had bottled dressing that I did not care for. It was more of an American salad look to it. I liked the variety in the banchan and overall it seemed fresh. I didn't particularly like the little patties, potato salad was good but I try to avoid carbs and stick to salad. Japchae was good.  I found the carrot sticks and I think it was cucumber with red pepper sauce odd (their take on buffalo wings' carrots and celery with ranch?)

On to the meat. We got the combo which it said is for 3 people. It didn't have all the meats I wanted to try but we figured since it's our first time we will try the combo. The majority of the meats were good,not amazing but the portion did seem small of how much of each they give. It ended up filling us up so it was fine. I thought the way the meat was served was cute and in theory sounded good but it didn't end up working too well then labels were removed and they put more than one meat on the grill (some were the same size) and so it was hard to differentiate between the meats and I had to ask waiters a few times which meat was what. 

I like the high ceilings, the non existent smoke filled rooms that usually KBBQ has, the modern look. It definitely sparked my interest enough to return and order a la carte next time. 

Although it does not compare to LA I think it's pretty good for Vegas. I want to try it again before making my final verdict.

I did have a little issue which is the same at all Korean restaurants- do I cook or does the waiter? They start off cooking then it's me then it's me waiting "Are they coming back? Do we just do it ourselves?" are questions commonly asked. I don't want to offend them but I don't want my meat overcooked!
Food was wonderful and server was super kind.  Everything was perfect.. I loved it. Wanna go there every week. ..
Very very authentic Korean restaurant. Their portion is really big. The meat platter includes a lot of side dishes.
Meat quality is really good, and our server is very attentive. A wide variety of side dishes which is unusual to see in town!

I've lived in Vegas for 14 years and have eaten at most of the Korean restaurants here and I went to this place today and I got to tell you the food and presentation was amazing! It's a little pricey than average but absolutely worth it. The restaurant is nice and new and has some sophistication in the waiting staff are very friendly and do a great job. The vegetables came out and were amazing fresh tasty and beautiful to look at. I highly recommend this place to eat.

Finally can escape the Spring Mtn/Chinatown area to enjoy some kbbq :) 
They have booth and floor seating available, the place overall is spacious.  Went in on Memorial Day and was able to get seated immediately.

Ordered the beef combination (serves 2-3) 
The meat was fresh and they cook everything for you. Only complaint would be with the bulgogi being overly sweet....the dipping sauce was weak, but the quality of the food made up for it.

Banchan on banchan, it was great. Both types of kimchi were aged and there was something for everyone, even if you are a picky eater.

The service wasn't bad. Always different people checking on the food and you. Overall for the cost/quality....it was on the pricier side.

I've been wanting to try out this place after driving by it so many times. It's easy to find right off Rainbow & Robindale.

We had the option to sit at a booth or the traditional style tables where you sit down on a pillow with no shoes on. We chose the traditional way to have a different experience. For a party of 3 , we ordered the beef platter and spent about 70$ altogether here. Other reviewers said the portions are small but I disagree. It was a lot of food for three people ! Meat quality is very good and there was tons of side dishes.

The servers cook for you all the way through for each meat in a prompt manner which was nice. With all the KBBQ restaurants on this side of town , this one is definitely up there (although I like Hobak a bit more due to better dessert selection and service).

The meat was great!! I ordered the $85 dollar special that included both beef and pork. The quality of the meat is a lot better compared to most kbbq places in Las Vegas so if you're a quality over quantity type of person Goong is good for you. Although it said the order was 4-5, a group of 2-3 can easily finish it. The downside would be the small and expensive portions but the overall ambience and service was really nice.

Honestly, this was one of the highest quality Korean restaurants I've been to in terms of meat quality and service. Unfortunately, I did not order barbecue this time because I wasn't quite that hungry, but the noodles and spicy chicken/rice dish I got was excellent. Everything about this place screams quality from the menus to the cutlery.
This is one of the best Korean BBQ. This is my second visit and we had the way u combination. It was so good. Highly recommend coming here.

We have gone to other Korean BBQ restaurants; however Goong Korean BBQ was/is the best. Goong gives you the option to chose  traditional Korean style seating or booth seating. They were friendly, Eun Sung (Chris)  and Haebin, were  very attentive, helpful and answered all of our questions. The food was amazing. We will definitely come again. THIS IS NOT WHAT YOU WOULD THINK A NEIGHBORHOOD RESTAURANT WOULD BE. WILL FAR EXCEED YOUR EXPECTATIONS!

I am updating my review as I made reservations for a party of 13 (private room) three weeks ago and confirmed my reservation the day of my son's graduation.  I even called to confirm my reservation 1 hour before getting there and the host confirmed it.  When I arrived with my party of 13, there were no tables available as they made way for  a party of 60 (for a one year old's birthday party) that was made only 1 week in advance.  They could have called me to cancel or tried to find a way to accommodate both parties; instead, they abruptly cancelled my reservation and made my celebration a complete bust.  We had to take our party to a restaurant next door.  This rudeness and greediness  is why I won't go back there again.  They did NOTHING TO MAKE UP FOR THEIR CANCELLATION.  Completely rude and unable to communicate in English.  Don't go there with any large party; they can't service the group.
Awesome place for a Korean BBQ. Friendly staff and good food. Cool looking decor too. My kid love it here and will come back.
I highly recommend this place. Will be my go to when in Vegas. Everything was really good. I enjoyed everything.

Came here cause of the star rating. It did not disappoint. The cuts of meat and amount of ban chan was exceptional. My wife and I came here back to back Sundays, the first was with my brother who was in town for the weekend. Since he and I grew up on good Korean BBQ (there is nothing like Mom's cooking) we know what to look for. I for one judge on the amount of ban chan a place is willing to put out. You can only go so far with Kimchi and rice. Second is the quality of meat, which each cut had such a distinct flavor it was amazing. Both times we ordered a platter which come with a choice of stew  and steamed egg. This is place offers refills  on  ban chan and rice.This place is worth every penny.

Second time here and I'm checking for some ice cream.
Good place with many side dishes. Good choice if you don't feel like ayce but you will be paying more for basically the same meats

The restaurant is clean & the food was tasty. The staff has good customer service. Even my 5 yr old liked the chicken. He's a picky eater & the chicken was his favorite. I definitely would come back again

Can service be too...attentive? 

I love that the restaurant is spacious, clean and modern. Love the many sides they give and the quality of the meat, this and Hobak definitely have the best meat quality in all of the Korean BBQ places and decent pricing too. 

But I was so annoyed being there, to the point where I could not have a conversation with my friend. We had about 4 different servers taking care of us... you would think this is awesome and service should be beyond expectations..but no. 

It was my first time there so I needed time to look over the menu, I asked the first server to give us some time, then 2 other servers came by wanting to take our order so we had to ask for more time again. 

Then my friend wanted pictures of some of the dishes so we told one of the servers that we can cook the meat ourselves, she let us be but the other servers kept coming by asking us if we are sure we want to do it ourselves. Then my friend wanted to cut the pork belly before it was fully cooked so it can cook more quickly, but a server came by and rudely asked "You cutting before its cooked?" - then he took over with the meat and told us "Don't cut ok?!" ... Seriously?!? We asked to be left alone... and they keep coming over acting like we don't know how to grill meat. The same guy came back and keep cooking our meats and was putting meat that I did not want onto my plate so he can cook more meat...they kept coming over and being in our faces we had to stop our conversation every time they come by. 

I get it that they are trying to give you good service, they are trying to cook the meat for us and its really nice of them... But they should let us be when we ASKED for it multiple times. My friend and I prefer to cook our own meat so we can eat at our own pace... these servers kept coming by and cooking meat continuously and we felt rushed to eat them all before they are over-cooked. 

They really should not have too many people working the same table, and they clearly don't communicate with each other since we had to repeat ourselves multiple times. The staff here are way too aggressive...it is as if they get annoyed that you are cooking your own meat! 

I really enjoyed the food, best meat quality and a great variety of side dishes. But when I have a meal, I like to be able to talk to my friends, I like to eat at my own pace and I generally like to be left alone so I could comfortably eat. This place is way too aggressive with their serving style and they are borderline rushing you to finish your meal and being rude.

Excellent service and very good cuts of meat. We got the beef platter and added some prawns. Everything was great. The sides are all good too. I usually don't like kimchi, but I didn't mind it here. It is a bit pricey, but worth it.

First time here and glad I came! Went with a friend and we got the marinated meat combo. Let me tell you...the menu says it's good for 2 people but it's more for a group of 4. It was A LOT of meat. So much so that we ate the rest for lunch the next day. It was all delicious too. The sides that came with the meal were great as well. They are a bit pricey compared to other Korean BBQ restaurants but you can taste the quality of the food. The waiter we got was wonderful too. He always made sure our water was filled and cleared off any plates we weren't using so our table wouldn't become overcrowded. Overall, would recommend this place!

Goong is best Ala Carte Korean BBQ's in Las Vegas hands down will come back again any day. The quality of the meat is outstanding compared to other places! It's very hard for me to go back to all you can eat Korean BBQ after I ate at Goong! And the service is amazing because there always around if you need anything. Once again can't wait to come back soon!!

I have this placed bookmarked for a year now. Finally made it in. 
Why 4 star- after being seated on our table.  It took a good 5 mins before a server noticed that we are just sitting down patiently with our menu closed- no drinks or food yet.  But the server made up for it during her service the rest of the night. 

Food is tasty. Good selection.  We got the marinated Meats and a side order of scallops. 
The meat quality is not as close as Hobak or 8 oz but closed enough.  The serving is more compared to those two places and cheaper too. 

I would go back and hope the server is more attentive when the customer gets seated. FYI. They have a cool sunken seats- didn't get to seat there.
Excellent steak, Black Tiger Shrimp plus amazing selection of sides free and unlimited free replenishment of sides!  Kid friendly, super service where they cook for you and super comfy booths.
Ok.  We went here because the smell in the parking lot was amazing!!! Even better... the BBQ in the table was fun!

After reading all the rave reviews we decided to try it out, walked in we were seated and left there to stare at the walls for about 20 minutes without anyone acknowledge us, there was a table that came after us which they were Koreans and they had a menu in their hand as they were sitting down. I had to flag them to even get water then after 10 minutes later I flagged her so we can get a menu so we can order our food, priced stupidly high and the quality of the meat did not look great. We just ended up walking out and trust me no one noticed because they just truly didn't care to tend to us.
This place has good food and good service. The meat was exceptional and the salt was good.

I wish I could give this place zero stars *disclaimer* we like the food... BUT

Holy **** the service was terrible. We had the pleasure of having "June" as our waiter.. we arrived at the restaurant around 10:44pm and right away he asked if we're sure we want to dine there because we only have 15 minutes to order. We said yes of course.... They close at 11:30
Right when we get our food he starts rushing us to hurry so he could close us out, mind you it wasn't even 11 yet! 
Then disappears to do closing duties while we're waiting for him to finish cooking the rest of our meal and turn the store back on... so we could leave.

THEN the worst of the worst happens, he puts the tongs he cooks RAW meat with in our salad...
I asked him curiously if that's where it's suppose to go knowing that's disgusting. He then SHRUGS it off and asks if we want a new salad. I said no thank you, and he just leaves it on our table.
We complained about the service, and feeling rushed out and asked to speak to a manager, he simply said he wasn't there and gave us the bill....

If I was employing this type of lazy service I would immediately fire them. Not only because he contaminated our food but when we complained he had no remorse he just wanted us out...

Tried this place on a whim. Wanted KBBQ but not the AYCE kind. Saw this place courtesy of fellow yelpers and decided to find out for myself together with the Mrs.  Place was very spacious, clean, and unique with the alternate seating options. Got the meat platter and it filled us up. The meat was quality. The ban chan was plentiful. The food was good. Service was great. Will be coming back.
The food is delicious! The price reflects the quality and amount of food served very well. The staff has always been friendly and helpful. You can dine on a traditional seat or western style seating.
First visit. Staff friendly and attentive. Had chic beef and pork. Marinated very tender and flavorful. Sides were well balanced.

First time visit!

I am a Korean so I think I have a good position to rate any Korean restaurant.

I rated 4 stars because they provided below

1. Very clean  and comfortable seats  2. Quite so very easy to conversation

3. Very kind of all staffs I met today  4. WOW free 10 over side dishes

5. Prices are reasonable    6. taste of Bulgogi ( kinds of beef and most common BBQ in South Korea)  is so so but the price is only $11.00 per one person. 

7. Interior is so nice and looks over moderate -class 

Recommend this restaurant?    ABSOLUTELY ! 

I could rate 5 stars if I tried other dish because my friend ate Kalbi  and he liked it very much.

The one of the best Korean BBQ restaurant in Las Vegas,  I think.

I would give this place 10 stars if I could. So we were starving since it was 930am already and we haven't had dinner yet. After searching and reading the reviews, we decided to try this place. At first we were skeptical since the place was close to empty. We learned that they are actually busy during lunch and dinner. This is not an all you can eat Korean bbq...just wanted to make that clear. We weren't sure what to get so we tried their beef platter. It comes with about 5 different kinds of meat. Each serving is about 4oz. When we got the meat, we were ready to order more thinking it wasn't enough. We were so wrong!! Jay was our server was awesome. He went above and beyond to take care of us so in return we took care of him too (by giving him a good tip). They serve so much ban chans that that alone made us half full already. The meat is of high quality. You can see it and taste it. We will be back for sure with our friends when we got back to Vegas. Best of all, they are open late on weekends.

Great food & service. I am a bbq newbie and everyone was very nice showing us how to cook everything. A lot of food and really good meat. We had a pork platter and sake. Very good. Enjoyed everything. Staff was  very sweet  and attentive. Excellent  on a friday night will return.
We got the Wagyu combination for two. It was very delicious and filling, if we weren't as hungry this would probably be a meal for three

Con: The restaurant does not adhere to their hours. My fiancé and I came here one night around 10PM. We walked in with another group and both were seated at the same time.  We sat there for over ten minutes and no one greeted us. There were several workers surrounding us cleaning up for the night. Although they list longer hours, it appeared that they were ready to shut down. We got up and walked out and no one said anything. It was pretty apparent that they wanted us to leave. 

Pro: We decided to give this place another shot and came in around 7PM. I am SO GLAD that we did. The quality of the food is incredible!! It is probably the highest quality Korean BBQ we have had in all of Vegas. The prices are well worth it! They insist on cooking the food for you as opposed to other Korean BBQ restaurants that allow you to do it yourself. Given that this is my fiancé's favorite part of the experience, he asked if they would mind allowing him to cook it himself to which they said no problem. They did pop over every now and then to offer tips. They also wanted us to move faster than we were (not sure why) but we insisted that we wanted to take our time. Overall, the service was great and the food was delicious. Can't wait to return!!!

Goong was very impressive. I have tried about a dozen Korean BBQ. Even done a spread or two at home. The parking is a bit tricky so car pool or park by the dentist office and get your steps in. The atmosphere was fun and stylish. Each seating area had lots of room with big tables which is so important when eating this style of food. We were greeted instantly and all the server's were very attentive. We went for dinner. I like to cook it myself and I had great conversation with each server that tried to help. I ordered the marinated meat combo and each flavor was better than the last. It may seem expensive but they serve you so much food. Totally worth it. The spicy chicken was a maranade of greatness. They make Lychee Beer and all there own sauces and kimchi. I cannot wait to go back for lunch to try cold soba and shabu.

Came here last night for my brother's graduation party and it started out pretty rough but rebounded quickly.  We had reservations for 8 at 4 and when we arrived they told us we didn't.  They eventually found our reservation (for two sets of 4, since each table seats 4) and we got in, 10 minutes later.  We had 6 menus between us and when my father asked for more, the waitress took my sisters and gave it to him...but then I asked for two more and two were brought out.  

We ordered our food, the two biggest things on the menu and the appetizers started coming out and filling our table which is cool because of the variety but the lack of space on the table was annoying.  As she was bringing out the side dishes, she spilled some sauce all over my brother's shoe and then just left it there until like 15 minutes later she got a napkin and put it on the floor over the spill (never picking it up over the course of the whole meal).  She then offered to clean my brother's shoe, again after about 20 minutes.  She took it and cleaned it which was nice but didn't do the best of jobs.  My sister also never got her apple soju she ordered.  I also feel like pop should have free refills instead of $2/can. 
 
Now, on to the food.  The side dishes were plentiful and some of them were indeed good but there was also a fair amount that were just ehh but I blame that on my lack of knowledge of Korean food and how little I've had of it.  The meat started coming out and it looked incredible.  Marbling was perfect, size was plentiful, and unlike some Korean BBQ places, the waitresses at Goong cook your food at your table for you so there's no guessing on when it is done.  The meats were amazing and just about erased my doubts about this place from the service.  They were spectacularly tender and melted in your mouth.  I loved the green salt that we had to add to it!   There was so much that our other table couldn't finish their food so the chefs cooked it up and packaged it to go for them which was awesome.

Even though the service started off pretty shaky, the quality of the ingredients and the fact that we didn't have to cook on a crappy, under-powered plate really brought this place miles ahead of other places in the valley (cough cough Gen).  I would gladly go back here because it was so darn tasty!  Maybe the service was ehh because we had a big group or because they only had one person sserving us even though the restaurant was dead or because she was just having an off day...idk but regardless, if you want some quality Korean BBQ, come here!
Best Korean BBQ in town!!!!  Food is always very tasty.  Nice and clean place.  Great quick service and very friendly staff.
My first time trying Korean BBQ! I love it! Already planning my next visit! Jihoon was great, thanks for the amazing service. My tofu soup was great, can't wait for winter to just order that.

Solid Korean BBQ with unique seating options 

Service
Generally pretty friendly and attentive. Meat was brought promptly and cooked well for us at the table. Extra sides were gladly provided as well on request. 

Ambiance 
Fairly standard Korean BBQ place, though they have some unique tables where you take off your shoes and sit on cushions (we tried this). It sounds odd but was actually comfy. If you do this, though, get a table on the end. If you're in the middle there's nowhere to rest your back. That looked not so comfy. 

Food
You can order packages of assorted meats or al la carte (we did this as we wanted kalbi which didn't seem to be in the packages). They bring tons of amazing sides first as is Korean tradition. Then they come prepare the meat for you. We had a spicy pork and kalbi. Both were very good though kalbi was not quite as tender as we would've liked. Generally the meat seemed of good quality. We noticed "martinis" on the menu in assorted flavors for $6. Seemed like a good deal, so we tried a peach and a grapefruit. They tasted like juice. I don't think there was booze in them at all. Well, they were delicious juices anyway. 

Mojo 
Overall a good Korean BBQ establishment with quality meat and good service and unique seating options. If you go, ask if the martini has booze in it before you order :)

The food is really good, everything tasted fresh and the cuts were top quality. The service wasn't great, had to ask for drinks multiple times. They also automatically added 20% gratuity which they did not deserve based on service. Ohhh.... they also didn't bring out everything we ordered but they removed those items from the bill so everything worked out as we didn't finish everything they did bring out

This place was really good! Food was great actually! Some of the best sides and appetizers I've had so far at Korean BBQ. The place feels a little fancy but I think it was actually rather "affordable". We got one of the meat combos, it was 85 dollars came with a bunch of really awesome looking meats and sides. It says it feeds 4 to 5 people, we we're 3 and a baby and  we all left happy and satisfied. It's different than other Korean BBQs I've been to, they put the meats on the grill for you and like come by and flip them and tell you when they are ready. Took me a sec to get used to that, but honestly the meats were all cooked better than when we've done it on our own haha. I felt like the service is super super attentive. The only thing is, they didnt give us like empty plates to like put the meats on when they are done. I feel like we were supposed to eat them off the grill, but they give you a million sides and apps and salads ( not complaining) and then the meats and they cool them one by one so we kinda felt like rushed a lil bit. I have a baby so I am pretty accupied a lil bit to like hurry up and eat the meats, and at one point they told us our meats were getting burnt haha. But we asked for plates and got them and problem was solved and it was smooth sailing after that. And they have soda by the can and even their tea was canned or bottled and I hate that at any place. But they do give you ice water in cute little cups and this awesome cinnamon tea at the end of your meal. This place was great in both food and service. We will totes be back. Really happy we tried this place. Super super yummy.

I came to Goong based on a recommendation from a friend that lives for Korean BBQ. It been while since had some so figure mix it up plus never been so why not right. I meet up with my cousin for dinner because Korean BBQ for one really makes no sense. Lol. 

The menu has a nice diversity and since it was both of our first time just made things more confusing. If not AYCE I always find that get the dinner for two or three people all based on the party...safe way too go. We decided on the beef platter for two or three people. Guess most of the meats all Wagyu meats or they promote it very clearly on the menu and in the restaurant. The lists of meats might not seen like lot there was six different cuts. It more then enough food. The SIDES never seen spread that literally covered the entire table. Hell we had no room for bowl of rice or the fact ordered cold spicy noodle dish (it sounded interesting and never had cold buckwheat noodles). The sides comes with two different soups both hell of good. The kim chee soup had great depth not just kim chee heat and the egg soup or custard really really good. I could have ordered big bowl of both with side of rice be happy camper. The sides so many different ones no way going remember them all. I been to other Korean BBQ that give you lot of sides but not only the different sides but some of them nice portion not just tiny scoop or couple pieces. Really no bad side that can remember they all solid plus one was japache. Two different kinds of salad that was really refreshing way to start the meal. The first set of meats comes on a really nice display each marked for the four different cuts. Definitely give it five stars on the presentation!!! They even had tags on them all fancy. They ask you the cut want start off with first. We just went with the waitress recommendation since it was our first time. Finish off was the brisket and last one was bulgogi. Halfway through they changed the grill always something notice and look for at Korean BBQ. The more meat or protein cook that should be automatic. They did! All the meats were awesome! SoooOOOO much food. I went into cow coma by the end of it. Some sides that never got around to cause I was that full of meat. Normally say AYCE Korean BBQ only way to go. Really with the recent rush of Korean BBQ or Hot Pot places around town. Quality over quantity is the Korean BBQ way too go. 

The platters may look pricey at first sight. If you break it down steal of deal in my mind. If you factor in all the sides (literally that could count for meal by itself...no joke) and the different protein. Awesome. The interior is very modern then other places around town. It little more dark on the inside with the decor. I like the way the booth and table set up with the grill. The location can be little deceiving cause it kind of hidden from DQ in front of it. I drove past it by accident. Just look for the DQ. If the parking lot full no worries just park at the one right next too it.

We tried out this place with some friends (party of 12) on a Sunday evening. The decor is very nice. It feels like a very cool place. The service is very good.

It is somewhat pricey, but the food tastes quite good. Overall, it is a very satisfying dining experience. If you don't mind spending a bit more for some good quality meats you'll definitely enjoy yourself here.

The food is delicious and the staff are super friendly! Highly recommended to anyone who likes Korean BBQ. The three of us got the combination plate which had beef, pork and chicken. The meal also came with a bunch of sides! The restaurant was very spacey and it's got a nice vibe to it!

I make this my number one Korean BBQ spot because of the quality.  you can taste a big difference compared to other restaurants.  i appreciate how they label the meat when you order the preset menu.  

I always go for the beef preset menu.  It comes with 6 different meats.  All the side plates, salad, soup, steamed egg are also included.  Plenty of food for 3 or 4 people I would say.  i love the two different salts the offer for your meat.  

The service is very attentive.  I can always rely on the server to cook my entire meal.  The food here for me is also craveworthy.  Every time I eat at this restaurant I can't ever decide what to eat first.  There are just so many options and flavors set on the table.  Everything is delicious.  If you appreciate quality it is worth the price.

Nice place, nice food... but, terrible service, specially by Sunny.
If you decide to come and have a nice dinner, be sure do not have the same luck in regards to be served by her, or in case that happens to you, then I hope you found her in better mood. 
In addition, I wonder where the law is in regards to the tips. I understand that if we have a bigger party, we should take care the server, but I didn't know that they charged us 20% after we looked in details the bill.

My friend introduced me to this place. Working in the industry, I was impressed w/ the service and attentiveness. The food was even better since I'm a heavy meat eat eater. I recommend ordering the brisket and galbi!!!
It was a long drive to get to this place but it was worth the drive.  We were welcomed with their friendly staff and our server was very sweet and nice. Food was great! Will go back here for sure.

This is probably my favorite Korean restaurant in Vegas. I love the spaciousness and cleanliness of the restaurant. The servers are polite. The food doesn't taste like  msg which is my favorite part. Try the kalbi-tang especially during the colder weather or when you're feeling under the weather. It's soothes the soul.

We just finished eating at Goong for the first time, and it certainly will not be our last visit there. The atmosphere is very low key and the staff are very attentive. We had one of the large combinations, beef and pork, and they served each of us a bowl of rice, and a bowl of marinated onions. We had 13 other side servings (I believe it was 13...it was a ton of food), along with our beef and pork. The cost for the entire thing was $85. That served 4-5 people, and yes, it was a great value and a ton of delicious food. The server grills your meat right at the table, and sets it to the side of the gill when it is done. Everything was top notch. And the staff couldn't have been more hospitable and attentive. You do have the option of sitting in a traditional booth, or removing your shoes and sitting on pillows on the floor. We chose the traditional booth setting. They serve Bori Cha (a traditional barely tea) so we didn't opt for anything else to drink. They also end the meal with a delicious cinnamon tea. There was no rush to our experience...everything was low key and considerate. We highly recommend Goong.
Service, superb, food is really very good. We ordered the galbi and the wagyu beef. Coupled with a bottle of soju, it was a most enjoyable dinner.  All the servers were attentive and friendly.
Lunch is 11:30 till 4 any day.  Great items and portions. Delicious banchan and not overly salted.
Second time trying Korean BBQ. The food was delicious and the service was great. The place I had gone to before  wasn't as good !

Goong stands out pretty well in quality terms of Korean bbq. 

The wagyu is extremely juicy and flavorful and doesn't even require any seasoning to be enjoyed.
The side dishes were also abundant, including steamed egg, spicy tofu soup, 2 salads and more. 

Service is very well considering.. It's a Korean establishment (it's okay to say, I'm Korean) and tops off other places cough tofu hut cough. We ordered the beef and pork platter and it came with enough food to more than satisfy 3 people. They will have ice cream as a dessert option in the near future which we were able to sample with our review. It actually has a surprisingly fresh and rich French vanilla taste and has good creamy consistency for a house made dessert, I was impressed.

The wagyu and bulgogi was the most tender imo off the meat selection, and being able to get a larger platter to try a variety of selections makes the experience more fun and enjoyable; something I highly recommend.

I have to say this place was moderately priced and pretty good in terms of quality and service.. Deserving my 4 star recommendation. Kahhhmn sahhmnii dahh
Customer service was fabulous and the meat was high quality. Definitely more of a place you go to every once and a while, just because of the price. I'll return though.
Visited this place many times and the food is always fresh and they have the best service in town!!!!! Highly recommend!!!

"Enjoy when you can, and endure when you must." - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

This is one of my favorite spots in Vegas for KBBQ. This isn't AYCE and you pay more for the better quality... But the fact that you're actually getting decent quality cuts of meat instead of the utter crap that is rampant at your standard KBBQ restaurant is well worth it. 

My love and I came in with Philip T. and Ayumi K. to share a feast of meat and a surprisingly wonderful assortment of banchan...after all, who doesn't love a feast of meat with wonderful sides? The four of us shared the Goong Special Platter that consisted of wagyu ribeye, wagyu top sirloin, wagyu chuck flat, prime boneless short rib, prime flat iron, pork belly, pork jowl, marinated prime short ribs, black tiger shrimp, and a choice of soup for $145. The meat portions were hearty, and It was more than enough food due to the ample and delightfully tasty banchan. Not a brad price per person with four of us...though if you aren't keen on enjoying great banchan side dishes the meat-centric individuals may only want to split this serving three ways.

Our server cooked the meats for us...he was attentive and accommodated our cooking temperatures nearly all of time. The hoods were good, minimizing the notion upon walking out that you just bathed in Korean BBQ...a huge plus! We shared a couple bottles of wine and still walked away at a reasonable price for the four of us.
Great service! Delicious food. Beautiful restaurant. We are so happy to have this place in our neighborhood.

Heard about this place for awhile but I never got a chance to try it until today! I personally prefer this place over Hobak or Magaul, the quality of the meat here is way better. They also give you a lot of delicious side dishes! I think our server Junhee contributed to the amazing experience, I'll definitely be back whenever I want Korean BBQ.

Totally on point 5 star Korean Bbq place. The side dishes are great and the staff are really friendly and helped us cook our foods on the grill. We were served a nice and cold tea which was surprisingly good and unexpected as I always like hot tea to go with my food but no complaint here since the cold tea was nice and refreshing.

Great place!!!great food!! And great staff they all were bey friendly  and helpful! took the family out for my aunts birthday it was great for the kids and they loved the food!!can't wait to go again!!

I love the food here but the service is questionable.  Upon ordering, told the waiter that we don't eat spicy so please don't bring the spicy side dishes.  The side dishes cane and I told the waiter to put the side door she's back on the cart as we don't eat spicy food.  He continues to pile on.  I had to raise my voice and daily again, we don't want the spicy side dishes.  "Oh, he says, you don't want the kimchee?" No, I said, no spicy side dishes.  Dude, what happened to pay attention to the customer?  
Food is great but you have to put up with incomplete.

Finally a good kbbq spot in vegas focusing on good quality meats. Prices are great for the quality and the portions. Service was really good as well. Definitely reminds me of kbbq in la. The galbi was super tender and flavorful.

???????????????????????
???????????????????????????????????????vegas??this is best best restaurant in the Vegas. Must come to visit place.
Everyone was so helpful and we were totally overwhelmed by the amount of food. Excited for leftovers tomorrow.
Very good Korean BBQ. Nice atmosphere, service is good, and food is great. Not smoky like other Korean BBQ places. Will be coming back again.
Very good here the staff r super nice the food is good the service is exiting love it
Go to Korean spot on the westside if you need your bbq fix without a wait.... hwaro and hobak wait is too long.  This is just as good!

Nice quality of meats being cooked at a good pace. Very attentive service and plenty of side dishes. The interior is pretty nice with a fancy yet traditional feel. Possibly the only thing I didn't like was the table space to the plates per cover ratio considering they do give a ton of appetizers.
