Other than that, it was a nice experience with great selection of higher quality Korean dishes. As a 3x visitor to Korea, this place reminds me of a lot of the nicer joints over there. Will be back for sure!

A truly exquisite Korean dining experience.

I highly recommend the Hot garlic spicy Sauce, out of this world.

Their fluffy egg is amazing!! I love their food and how the staff comes around and cooks the food for you. The tea at the end is amazing to help you digest all the food you just ate lol. This place can get very busy on the weekend but it's worth the wait.

With all these new Korean BBQ joints that's been popping up all over Las Vegas, i've been on a Kbbq quest to find the best tasting KBBQ in town!

This place is convenient and opens late. But the portions are extra small! My party (4ppl) got the beef combo platter($65). The platter included ALOT, ALOT of sides, from tofu soup, steamed egg, jap chae, kimchi, water kimchi....etc. That was a great plus to our dinner! I honestly could of just been satisfied with eating all the side dishes! When we started grilling our meat. The grill was not set high enough to sear the outside of the meat, instead it started dehydrating our meat! So our first & seconds sets of beef were extra dry! Tasted like beef jerky!! By the time we had the 3rd set of beef on the grill we finally turned up our grill ourselves. After all that I would say their beef is just okay. I personally would of liked my beef marinaded and or seasoned. We also ordered the grilled tiger prawns, it was ok. 
The best tasting item here is probably the free jap Chae. Other than that I don't think I would be back! I'll rather drive the extra few miles down to spring mountain and eat at Hobak! I can't wait to try Magal BBQ soon!

Absolutely loved our experience here. We sat at the tables where we had to remove our shoes. There were 4 of us, but the 4th person ordered outside of the grill. The remaining 3 shares the beef package for 2-3 people. 

All the banchan were tasty and went well with the meats. The meats included wagyu, but it was just as exceptional as the other cuts of meats. I'd have to say though, the quality and taste is above and beyond many other KBBQ in town. I'd have to say this takes 2nd best in Korean BBQ in Sin City for me. (Hobak #1). 

We came for lunch and were among only a few customers there at that hour. Service was good. We will definitely be returning and referring friends to this place.
The price is right. If you are dinning as a couple or you are just hungry get one of the combo plates. Your table with be filled with food far and wide. Try the 3 types of kimchi spicy yummmm

Eating dinner at Goong.  Having oxtail soup 

Good bbq will have next time. Check in offer for free soda is good. Good environment and fair service. Lunch special is ok and changing menu soon.  

Often come here for dinner or lunch. Will be interested in trying their new bbq sets
Prob my favorite out of all kbbq in this town. Pretty attentive customer service will be back! Beef bulging Always on point

A little ways off of the strip but well worth it. Ambiance is nice clean, modern with an amazing assortment of banchan. Meats are excellent in quality but the spicy pork for me fell a little short. Service is impeccable and the prices are fair. Like I started this review, the banchan was simply amazing.

Enjoy.

Service was great and A LOT of banchan (we shouldn't have ordered a side of rice). Between the two of us we ordered the beef platter and oh my goodness it was a lot of food. No wonder why it was a bit pricey. Next time we will order the individual plates. The food was great however the waiter cooking the meat came off a little intrusive during our dinner, but I'd definitely come back here again.

Goong provided an enjoyable yummy experience for us!  The four of us were able to sit and enjoy each other's company as the staff made the evening perfect.   The BBQ experience was a little different, we ordered the beef combo with garbi, the staff cooks the meal, while you picked off the grill.  The pices were bite size and the sides were delicious!  I found it super easy to enjoy Korean BBQ!   I think when we have people come into town this will be our go to place to catch up with our friends and eat yummy food!  The seating is pretty cool, but I think I'll sit in the booth next time so I can lean back.

Japanese style table. Awesome.  

Service: Server was awesome. Unfortunately I don't remember his name,  but he was Asian.  He was get very patient and attentive and even cooked my brisket for me. 

Food: it was really good.  I'm really picky but I ended up really liking the dipping sauces.  It wasn't ayce but it was just enough to fill me up.  Plus you get 16 different sides.
Delicious!  I love all the sides and the BBQ was so good.   Definitely would recommend this place. Cute atmosphere.

First time here and our experience was great!  The quality of the meat was fantastic, service was really good and atmosphere very open.  My friends who have not been to a Korean BBQ restaurant were extremely impressed for a first experience!  My new KBBQ spot for sure!
The food and service is great! They're attentive and fast at refilling the side dishes. The cinnamon tea at the end is the best!

Being Korean, I am super picky with my korean   food. The bonchon was lackluster and mainly tasteless. The kimchi was horrible. The meats were ok, fresh yes...but the prices were insane for the amount of food you get. Do not drink the barley tea...yes, they messed up the tea.
Very good and close to my house! Finally don't have to drive far for good Korean BBQ!!!

*Friendly staff, many choices of lunch menu.
*yummy small side dish.
*area is clean and neat.
*blue diamond area close to my house.
I just went here a few hours ago and I enjoyed it. It was clean and the staff were pretty nice. There were still a few flaws but other than that it was amazing.

Most definitely the best Korean Bbq place ive ever been to. Right when you walk in, the ambience is relaxed and classic. warning: you do have to take off your shoes. My husband and I went here and we were overwhelmed by how many side dishes and how much meat you get for 65 bucks. We had a great experience here. This is a good date and anniversary place. whoever you will take here, will be truly impressed.

This place is seriously the best korean BBQ places I've ever eaten at in LV. Not only is the service absolutely fantastic, the food is absolutely delicious as well. The ventilation is great, so I don't feel like I smell disgusting when I leave. I can't wait to come back. Also the BBQ combination for 2-3 people is definitely enough for 4-5 if you are a light to medium eater. The side dishes are also incredible as well.

Everything about this place was amazing...from the look outside to what u see when the doors open to the service u get and the quality of the food u eat. I have gone to several different Korean restaurants and yes, they were cheaper but all in all this place was worth the price. Very satisfied customer
Came here with my husband and in laws. We thought the food wouldn't be enough but it definitely filled us up. Everything was delicious.

My Las Vegas trip, this place was one of the great restaurants including 5start hotel's buffet in Las Vegas. The place is not americanized Korean BBQ  restaurant.  It is more like traditional way to enjoy K-food without too salty or overly sweet.

Every time our company has a tradeshow, we bring our guests from Korea here because the ambience is very Korean. They have bbq but I think their specialty is the Galbi Tang. Super good. I am very impressed they had Yook-geh-Jang Galbi Tang. Very rare..havent seen that combination in L.A. or Orange County .CA.
Very good.

Although, everytime I had some soon-doo-boo there, I was in and out of the bathroom for hours. Maybe too much MSG.

But the Galbi Tang's were not a problem.
Will definitely go back.
This was such a fun experience eating barefoot and cooking our own food.  The meats were delicious!

Terrible customer service..
Very well decorated classy place but the servers were so rude came by Twice during entire dinner and to get my orders and to hand over the check 2nd one that we had to called them over.)
We ordered 2 orders of Galbi(short ribs), 2 orders if Galmegisal and Biji-Jjigae(Soybean soup) for 3 people.
Galbi was ok nothing exceptional other two items were HORRIFYING :-(((
They placed my meat on wrong kind of grill for the kind of meat I ordered then left for good then it started burning like hell :-/

Bottom line :
SERVICE ZERO STAR!!!! 
FOOD 1 STAR!!!!
PRICE 1 STAR!!!!

No reason for my family ever going back there.
P.S. it was my teenager boy's birthday dinner and he has never been a picky eater especially for the Korean BBQ and he told me he doesn't want to eat here anymore :-(  ruined b-day dinner...

Excellent food and excellent service. The ambience felt warm, elegant, and modern with Asian influence. We went for lunch time. I had the dolsot bibimbap and my husband had the chicken spicy fried rice. We enjoyed our meal. Lots of flavors. We were greeted with little compliments. At the end of our meal we were given cold cinnamon tea. Will definitely return for dinner.
Been coming here for a long time now. Food is great and fresh. Servers accommodating. Plenty of side dishes. Kyle is a very good server

This is probably the swankiest Korean BBQ place around. They went all out making the space look sexy and modern, making it a spot worthy for a date night or just hanging out with your friends. Tables are large with plenty or space for you to spread out so you don't have to worry about bumping elbows. 

They've got so many different cuts of meat that's it's overwhelming. You're better off going with one of their specials like the Goong special ($145) advertised as being good for 4-5 people. It includes wagyu rib eye, wagyu top sirloin, prime boneless short rib, wagyu chuck flat, prime flat iron, pork belly, pork jowl, marinated prime short ribs, and black tiger shrimp. With that many items it's easy to lose track of what is what. So, you just dig in. I think some of my favorites were the wagyu rib eye... or was it the top sirloin... or maybe the flat iron. I don't really know. Again, it was hard to remember what cut I was eating, but it was all good.

Another thing that was slightly confusing was the banchan... was that all you can eat? We had to request seconds of a couple dishes. And, when the bring out dishes you have to eat them family-style not individual dishes. 

If you don't care about those small details, you'll love this place.

Lots of different variety meats with more than enough side dishes to pair with. There was so many side dishes we didn't have room. The ambience was really neat- we took off our shoes and sat in little booths like we would in South Korea. Great service. Would recommend!
This is not the first time but the various time that I 've been there they took about 30 minutes before they came to take the order.  The restaurant was not busy at all, we were the only ones there

Great atmosphere, exceptional customer service and high quality meat. Beef platter is definitely a must try for all you beef lovers! Comes with a gracious combo of prime rib, wagyu top sirloin, prime chuck flat and thin sliced bulgogi! Different from other Korean BBQ spots. Cause they actually cook it for you!

The food here is all about quality! They do not hold back on the side dishes! Definitely get the short plate beef, it's the most tender in my opinion and also my favorite. If you have a party of 3 or more, then just get one of the combo platters. Jun, Connie, and  Geon were all at our service the whole time. Great service!
Amazing service, amazing taste, amazing ambiance. First ever time not doing all you can eat and all i have to say is wow. Quality over quantity everytime!

We came hungry. Sat at the traditional seating area, ordered the Beef Platter. They set us up with the side dishes and specialty salt WITH explanations. Steven cooked our beef medium rare as requested. This place is superb; food is delicious. Needless to say; we have converted from all-you-can eaters to specialty korean BBQ like this.

If you like meat being cooked at your table, this is the NEW place to try.  Not all you can ear.  $175 for table of 7 before tips.  Prime meat is ok, but try the waygu, its much better.  The portions are on the small side.  Service is excellent.
Kimchi and side dishes are good.  Atmosphere is great.  High ceilings and lots of room.  Like all Korean BBQ places, be ready to take a shower when you get home.  Happy Kimchi Friday.

I've gotten much larger servings at other Korean Bbq restaurants for similarly priced menu items. We ordered just the marinated, thinly sliced ribeye and galbi shortrib entrees, and even my elderly mom (who doesn't each much) complained that it was barely enough to satisfy her hunger. The $20 galbi (1 bone and some small chunks) was a little tough to chew, and the $13 ribeye bulgogi tasted a little too salty. The service was also slower than expected, and we had to quiet our grumbling stomachs with the banchan dishes because it took almost 30 minutes for the kitchen to make our 2 simple meat orders! We sat on the booth side because we didn't feel like doing the table cooking, but on hindsight, we probably could've had our meals ready sooner if we had cooked it ourselves. Neither the food nor the service was worth the total on the bill.  I only went there for lunch, and I'm wondering if the better quality meats are being saved for dinner. Too bad I'm not interested in trying this place again.

Absolutely love the service and quality of food of this place! A year  ago we would have to drive all the way to Chinatown for Korean BBQ but so thankful this area has grown with great eats. Everything we had was amazing. We got a family meal and we were so full by the end. The meats are fresh and delicious. The service was amazing and they were on top of making up feel welcome and have a wonderful experience. Highly recommended and we will definitely be coming back.

Whatever stereotype you may have of Korean BBQ restaurants, Goong is on a mission to redefine it! It's not about stuffing yourself here. Rather, Goong focuses on delivering experience and emphasizes on presentation. Definitely a good choice to come for a date, meet the parents and business meetings. 

I had the Goong special which comes with a variety of meats such as wagyu beef, ribeye and marinated kalbi. The wagyu is amazing and my favorite. The banchan and soups are spot on. The middle dining area is old school Korean style with the low tables where you sit on the ground. The surrounding areas all have normal tables and benches. 

I love the atmosphere. Only thing strange was the edm music lol. Not quite the genre I would tie in with Goong. All in all, would love to come again. Prices can be a bit hefty but hey trust me, you get what you pay for.

This place was very delicious, good quality meats and solid service.
It loses a star due to price, which is lower at similar restaurants for similar quality food. 
The filet was delicious, and the beef fried rice was the highlight of our visit.
First timer right when we walked in feels very modern and clean. The food pictures/quality looked very good can't wait to try them!

Honestly; I think this place is rated high because of the discounts they offer after leaving a "good" review on Yelp. The food was okay, but a bit overpriced. Service wasn't up to par and for some reason communication was hard with our server that night. In my opinion the place was a solid 3 stars, but there are better and cheaper KBBQ options around Las Vegas.

My girl and I ate here last night. We had  a few minutes left for last call but still had an hour or so to eat. I felt it was best to order the beef platter if it's your first time, therefore the next time you go, you can actually pick and decide what meats you want. In my opinion I thinks it's best to do it that way. The atmosphere and ambience expiernce is by far superb in my books. Friendly staff. Always checking in on you.Big plus was the rice paper. A lot of Vegas Korean bbq places don't have that. Side dishes were also good. At first I thought it wouldn't be enough meat for 2 people. I was wrong, lol. I'm definitely going back there again.
This place is quite fancy than I expect. Taste is excellent also. I certainly recommend here.

The meat melts in your mouth and our server John was really chill. We had a great conversation with even greater food. Get the prime boneless short rib and the bulgolgi fried rice! You won't regret it

I'm originally from Los Angeles, Koreatown and moved to Las Vegas 5 years ago. Good Korean food is hard to come by in Vegas, and it wasn't until I discovered Soyo Barstraunt that I had a "go to" spot to get my Korean food fix. When I heard that the owners of Soyo were starting up a Korean BBQ place, I was excited! I tried Goong out yesterday and was not disappointed. First off, the ambiance and décor is very trendy & modern but with a traditional Korean twist. The interior designer they chose did a very nice job. Looking at the menu, we were initially overwhelmed with the meat choices, but the staff did a great job of explaining the menu and making recommendations. We went with the beef combination that came with steamed egg, doenjang soup, and a variety of different cuts of beef including Wagyu prime ribeye! I was most impressed with the "Chadol-baegi" or thin sliced brisket as this is the meat that is commonly bad in Las Vegas. Most Korean BBQ places in Vegas will use a very tough cut with no fat and it tastes horrible. Goong used the proper selection of meat, just as you'd find in Ktown, LA. The assortment of side dishes ("Banchan") that came out was also all very good and was really on par with the food you would get in Ktown, LA. The amount of food was a lot for the two of us, and the price was pretty reasonable considering that this is an upscale Korean BBQ spot, and not some dirty, dingy, place serving low grade cuts of meat. All in all, it was an excellent dining experience and I would highly recommend this place! It's definitely my new favorite Korean BBQ restaurant in Vegas!
Service was awesome!!! The meat was fresh & delicious!!! Ask for HS Kim, he was our super nice waiter.

I have tried the better known Korean restaurants in NY, LA, SF and Chicago and was never really impressed (they all used too much MSG and other flavor enhancers to mask their skill insecurity), so I only ate when in Seoul at the better places during business trips. However, as unlikely as it may seem, a gem of a Korean restaurant with the highest culinary skills and ingredients has emerged out of all places - in Las Vegas. I was so glad to find this place that I wrote to my friends abroad to try this place when visiting.

Yes, it is pricey relative to "other" Korean places but I actually would like to compare this place to American steak houses (those serving Prime meats). Then, the price is actually quite reasonable.

The side dishes are well made rendering their innate flavors without being overpowered with spices. The meats are high quality and the setting including the decor is elegant and minimalist. The restroom is very clean, too. The service is not intrusive, on purpose I think, to give customers some privacy...but will respond quickly if needed.

I have been a happy Yelp reader/viewer for many years but this restaurant truly motivated me to actually write my first review. Highly recommended.
Had the naengmyun. Very refreshing during this hot weather. Good service, food tastes good. Thanks Goong!
The best korean resturaunt ever. Really good service. They were helpful with any questions we had and they help cook the food. Love it here. Try the sit down area in the middle!

Read reviews online and this lives up to the good reviews. Excellent service,  awesome banchan and really flavorful meats. Reasonable price too.... if you want good K Town type food.... come here you won't be disappointed.

Best Banchan in town, this place kills it and isn't even on Spring Mountain!

Goong is the go to when I feel like splurging on KBBQ and don't want AYCE. The only other non AYCE place ill even go to is  Gangnam but the quality here is far superior. 


That being said also one of most expensive KBBQ places in town so don't go if you want a bargain, but do go if you want some great cuts of meat and amazing banchan!

I was so excited to try this place after the great reviews and left extremely disappointed. I ordered, as suggested, one Goong special which was supposed to feed 4-5 people. There was 5 people at my table and we all left hungry. The food had a good variety but extremely small portions. The rib eye had 8 chunks of meat and they brought ONLY TWO Tiger shrimp for a table of 5!! WTH?! Are we supposed to dice the shrimp to share it?

We will not be coming back.

This place was so amazing! I was visiting Vegas for EDC and was crazy some Korean bbq, I'm originally from San Jose California and eat Gen Bbq a lot but since we wanted to try something new, this was the spot to go!! I ordered the beef and pork platter and it was perfect for 5, because we initially wanted the wagyu beef platter but since our waiter requested that the beef and pork was a better option for us to have more variety, it was so tasty and the portion was perfect! I recommend the beef and pork platter if you have a party of 4 or more. I am forsure coming back the next time I visit again.

Tried this place last night after seeing it a few weeks ago. Amazing! The only complaint I have is the menu needs better English descriptions. Our server was extremely helpful in explaining the menu though, so it's not a big deal. We had floor seating where you take off your shoes. Comfy cushions and it's not difficult to get in or out of the tables. 

We ordered the wagyu beef platter. It's supposed to be for 2-3 people, but I would say it could feed more like 4. The platter came with a ton of different sides: kimchi, onion salad, green salad, black beans, squid, seafood pancake, tiny little pancake that had jalapeños, radish, eggplants, soup, and more that I can't recall. Then there was the beef with a large variety of cuts. Two types of seasoning to use and the usual soy sauce to accompany the food. We also had Korean wine, which was so tasty! 

Service was amazing. They helped us cook our food as needed, and we're generally amazing. The manager came to talk with us after our meal, which I thought was so great. The the price was amazing. About $140 for everything; beef, sides, and many drinks. I will definitely be coming back soon!

I have been here several times and while the quality of meat and food in general is excellent the service aspect could use some work.

I have been here a few times and I can say Goong definitely has the best quality of any of the Korean BBQ restaurants I've been to in town.  They always have a nice variety of side dishes and their entrees are reasonably priced.  They have a few platters for parties of 2-3 or more which are great.  I especially enjoy the Beef Platter.  It's $65 and servers 2-3 people.  They have a pork one as well which is $45.  

The downfall to this restaurant and for my experience is the aggressiveness of the servers.  Each time I've been here with my Korean friend the servers will rip the utensil out of her hand when she is flipping the meat.  At any other restaurant they let you cook it however one time when we came here the server even said something as she was clearly upset that he kept taking the tongs from her.  Today we had only been seated for a few minutes and we were asked 3 times if we were ready to order.  We clearly were not.  

If the interpersonal skills were better this place would be top knotch.

Good meat is here.
Goong is have one of the best meat i have been tasted in town. This place is huge and havd a unique design, more private. The servers was nice and talkative. The price is kind of a little high, but not a problem for excellent meat.
Jhoon is the best waiter. come here for an amazing meal. 10/10. Great place for a huge meal with the family.

This is the best restaurant I've ever been. The employees are nice and the food is great. Come to Vegas!! This restaurant will make your day, or night! The Jigae (stew) taste wonderful, the meat is excellent, and the appetizer is amazing!! Come here yourself, and taste Heaven!!
Yummy food, great drinks, when they say it's spicy...they mean it! Soooo good! Can't wait to come back during our annual trip to Vegas!
Great food great service the Extras are bomb. Staff is friendly. Wait time is never an issue.
First time here, and we're impressed. Great cuts of meat, and friendly staff. Here with our two younger kids, and it's seems to be family friendly. We'll be back again :)

So sad to see this place turn to crap!  We've been going to Goong since it first opened and have always raved about the place. My husband and I have our date night one a month at Goong and we've always loved the food and the service. Well, the service is still good but the food has really gone downhill. For the last three times we've gone, slowly but surely they started eliminating some of the side dishes (namely the Korean potato salad and then the green papaya salad), then the meat portions started getting smaller and smaller, and finally, the quality of the meat was just awful on our last visit. We always order the Wagyu top sirloin and the tenderloin and they were terrible: fatty, gristled, really tough to chew.  We complained to our server who just smiled (yes, I said smiled) and did nothing to correct the problems.  She never offered to replace the bad meat, or offer us other side dishes, she just smiled and walked away.  Maybe a language issue????  Needless to say, we won't be back. Sorry Goong, three strikes and you're out.

Great quality and fantastic service! We had a super large party (bigger than we originally told them) and they were quick to accommodate and worked hard to get our orders out in a timely manner. I was super impressed!
Beef platter was good. Pricey but good quality. Service was good. Waiter did all the cooking and flipping and very attentive. Highly recommend. No wait time when we went in.

Gieon was our server, and he was AMAZING. I mean, the food was great, but he made the experience even better. Gieon was friendly AND polite. We ordered the Goong Special, which was $145. Let me tell you, IT WAS WORTH EVERY PENNY. The meal was for four people, and we were all FULL. This is one of the few restaurants YOU should splurge at. 

Thank you to Gieon for treating us well, and thank you to the restaurant for existing. :)

Came here on a Friday and restaurant wasn't busy. The staff was fantastic and sides were plentiful and filling. 

We ordered the beef platter and was enough to make 3 people full.

-meat wasn't frozen 
-plenty of sides 

And free desert if you right a Yelp review  10/10 recommend

This review is for 3.5 stars. 

As far as taste of the food, Goong is as good as it gets in Vegas. Some of he most extensive banchan in the game with soups per person and about a dozen small plates including a few radishes and a few kimchi offerings.  Though they charge extra for refills, as an FYI. We had the marinated meat platter ($65) which included 2 porks, 2 beers and a chicken. Couple that with about 5 sojus and the meal was tasty. However, on a Saturday night it was unbelievably dead. With that said, our servers had nothing to do yet we're still a little angry with us as we were eating a little slow to their taste and it was ruin the cooking preparation.  And we got last call way too early and were rushed out. Finally, they offer free ice cream with a Yelp review, but they stand over your shoulder as you write it which artificially inflates the review.  Overall a good Korean BBQ but not the best, or cheapest, by any means in the city.

Nice new Restuarant. Ok nothing special 
Food nor Service. Pricey for the quantity of meat serviced. Ordered family style and given approx 8 diff cuts of meat- a few were quality tasting most others plain and basic.
Feeding four people with 7-8 inch size cuts seems unreasonable if you compare to most other Korean restaurants. So someone always got one piece while others got two.
Unfortunately will not be back.
Best Korean bbq we have been to in Las Vegas !!!! Highly recommend you won't regret! The food is so good! Coming back for sure!

THIS by far, is the best meats you'll ever have in a Korean Barbecue joint. They select their meats very carefully and when they cook them in front of you for you, they do not overcook them. We had the beef combo + pork belly and their small plates and tapas were excellent. nothing is over done, and to me all the flavors were done correctly including palate wash.  Our servers/cook were all attentive. 

The decor and ambiance is amazing, and the place is very clean with simple lines. I appreciated the spa-like candles they had before getting to the Women's Lounge (restroom)

This has been the best Korean bbq I've been to yet...

I liked all their side dishes and they gave you more choices than most other K BBQ's. We got the beef platter and all of the meat was of good quality. The prime ribeye was delicious!!!

This was our grandson's choice for his 5th birthday and it was the perfect choice. We had the marinated meat platter and the shrimp and both were outstanding. The selection of banchan was excellent, with several different choices. We really loved the onion salad and the sweet potato noodles. And they brought out a spectacular birthday dessert. A real 5* experience.

Great for Korean BBQ. Quality service and fresh side dishes along with good clean cuts of meat. We got the beef combo and an order of pork belly. Did not disappoint. Buddy and me got full at half the price of what it would cost on the east coast. 

Best place to bring visitors from out of town.

My family and I had lunch here. The restaurant was quiet. Great ambient and decor. We ordered the marinated meat selection. They were delicious. So many free side dishes. So much food!  The service was excellent. Full service! They cooked and cut up the meat into bite size pieces for us. Finally a Korean BBQ restaurant that I can just enjoy my food and have someone else cook my meat right in front of me. We were also surprised with a delicious cinnamon punch at the end of our meal.  I will definitely come back when I'm in Las Vegas.

What's to say? The whole time we were there it felt like we were being rushed and they couldn't wait till we left. They had closed down 80% of the restaurant at 10:50pm, when they closed at midnight.  The chairs were on the tables, floors mopped and nobody in sight. We walked away, double checked the closing time, still midnight, so we doubled back and finally saw a waiter. Food was good, but they asked to cook the meat for us in the kitchen (so they didn't have to clean another grill?). Our server took our order and this is my personal pet peeve, HE DID NOT WRITE DOWN THE ORDER. I don't care who you are, write it down or have a photographic memory. He forgot the drink I ordered and brought it to us as we asked for our to-go boxes. Would it of killed him to write it down? Maybe but at least my order would have been complete. All of the side dishes, and there are plenty, were wonderful, except for the weird soupy thing I did not care for, but they put them down without really explaining which dipping sauce went with what. Overall, pricey, a-la-cart and decent food but not worth the rush. 
*TIP - only go for the complimentary cinnamon tea at the end. It was dabomb.com.

Walking into Goong I immediately felt a warm and classy ambience. To my surprise, our waiter didn't know as much about the menu as I thought he would given the high class environment. When we tried to ask questions the he seemed just as confused as we were. Luckily he saw my frustration and sent another waiter to the rescue , who was explain the different type of meat and menu . The variety of side dishes and the tenderness of the beef were enough to give Goong 4 stars .
Exceptional flavors and despite a slow start service was good as well!!! Great lunch specials!

A lovely lunch spot. Food - authentic and tasty;
Service - Very good ;  Environment - clean, nice background music

Combo lunch with choice of three items is a good deal $15.00.

Short Ribs in beef broth $10 ( 3 1/2 stars)
Kalbi BBQ short ribs $21 (4 stars) it was a tasty plate with one big bone and 4 small- medium slices 
Cut from it. Not worth it at all. Still hungry!

We have tried several different Korean BBQ places in the Vegas area (even other 4-5 star establishments)...and I would say this place is very good!  Lots of sides but the best part is the quality of the meats.  Just amazing! Service is great as well.  This is our go-to place for Korean BBQ.  We continue to come here and the quality does not change...and service is always good.  We did come on Valentine's Day as well...they were very busy, but still managed to give us good service.  I would say that day wasn't a 10 (like all the other times), but they were very busy...and we didn't mind because the staff all looked very focused....they were trying.  
Anyway...definitely recommend this place to everyone.  For us, we bring all of our visiting friends...pretty much the first recommendation we give to most asking about Korean BBQ. 
Enjoy!!
Pricey but food was good. Meat was also good. I prefer magal kbbq over this but both kbbqs are my top favorites
Second time here in less than a week and like our first visit, everything here is the best. Excellent Service and food.

This is now my favorite Korean bbq! I have a big family so the meat platters are so worth it. The environment is nice and the servers are great.  Usually at Korean bbq restaurants with table cooking you order the meat and you have to cook it....not here. You order the meat platters and they do the rest. The spread is amazing and yummy. The meat is so good. 5 stars hands down. If I could give more I would!

Tried this place for the first time & it was delish! We got the beef platter. Pricey but such good quality beef. Definitely be ready to eat a lot of it because it comes with a lot! Also came with so many sides most good some I wasn't a fan of.
Tried the peach beer, different but good. 
One of my favorite things was the dessert. Not sure exactly what it was but tasted like cinnamon tea, served cold. 
Menu was a little difficult to read but you manage & servers are friendly & helpful. Love that you could sit on the ground with pillows or a traditional booth. Will be back!

The staff here is very well attentive and well mannered our  waitress (Miss Moon) was great . Food was great and sides were tasty.  But if you go here be hungry if you get a combination platter it's a lot of food . Can't wait to go for another visit to try something else . To happy eating .
Excellent service. Excellent food quality. I highly recommend. Why drive to spring mountain when I can be completely satisfied in my neighborhood. Thank you for the amazing evening.

We are regulars here since this is by far the best Korean bbq in town. Food is top notch and the service has always been amazing, although tonight's service is just so so.

Our server seems like she's rushing everything and often almost seems irritable or uninterested about something. Who knows? Maybe she wants to go home early? I mean we actually thought we had to rush eating because they might be closing soon until other customers started showing up. She basically served all the meat without even telling us what exactly are we eating. So we often have to ask her what is on the grill throughout the whole service. She seems new though so that might be it. Everybody else here had been amazing though.
Good food quality with great customer service, worth it to come and give it a try! Definitely will bring friends and family to come again! Modern remodel!
So far I've only been at lunch- the BBQ & veggie platter combo is huge and delicious, beautifully presented. Service is always friendly, and side dishes are top quality.

I was here last year in July since it was so close to my parents. I don't think I will ever come back here again. Service and food were both mediocre. We had 9 people so they sat us to the right in its own room but the 2 tables were still separated. I don't remember much of it which means it was clearly not the best Korean bbq I have had.

Love this place .... friendly staff and clean place 
Food were delicious and the beef are so tender and tasty I would recommend to all my friend
This is now my favorite Korean BBQ spot. Food was fresh and amazing. HS Kim gave incredible customer service.
I think it was too expensive for the value . No flavor. Very plain. Side dish was ummm yeah no good..

Great Korean bbq spot . The restaurant was very clean. The service was great . There were 3 of us and we went at the end of a night on a Sunday so they close earlier on Sunday's . The service was still great even though we were the last people in the restaurant . We got the beef and pork platter. The beef was top notch quality and was mouth watering good . The pork was great too . All of the sides were good . The pickled radish being my favorite . Everything about this place is great and it's a great value too . The 3 of us were plenty full and satisfied and for only 120 all in with gratuity . I will be back soon.

Excellent service very friendly. Nice dining atmosphere. This place was recommended to us to try out and we enjoyed it. Praise are reasonable but we were there on a mini get away so that didn't bother us. Highly recommend this place to all my friends who visit Vargas!
Finally a five star Korean restaurant in southwest part of Vegas! Great for families and large parties. Quality of beef was excellent! Service was great too. Will definitely come back for more!!
Fantastic new find in SW Vegas. No need to go to Spring Mtn anymore for great Korean BBQ. Excellent quality meats and friendly attentive service. Definitely will return to try other specialties.

The food is amazing. I highly recommend this place! The Wagyu was amazing and the rice bowls were nice and warm when they were served  to me. 
The waiter was so nice and provided me with everything I needed.
Yea food was good. Not ur typical Korean bbq where you cook your own meats. Must try if your in area. Will be back

Location: the place was easy to find. It's partnered with a lot of Asian restaurants that are one by one person.  The parking is somewhat limited so you'll have to find parking elsewhere, if it's too packed. 

Environment: everything inside was well organized.  Nothing too flashy. 

Food and service: the food was pretty good for the price. We ordered the beef set and seafood pancake. The food came on time and was not over cooked or left to dry. The quality of beef was great for the price. The banchan served was good quality except the fish cake. A bit too soggy for me. But asides from that everything was made with good flavor. 

Bathroom: clean and modern. Single stall with a urinal for the men and 2 stalls for the women's bathroom 

Overall, surprisingly good food and service. I'm surprised it wasn't as busy for a weekend . Definitely a must go.
Best place to eat Korean BBQ and the service was outstanding. Differently will be back

If you wanna try 'high quality' Korean bbq, this is the perfect place for you! I like this place much more than Hobak bbq regarding nice decor & more family friendly ambiance though I still like to go Hobak:) I thinks this place & Hobak are the best places for Korean bbq.
A great Korean restaurant, come here and have a try and a cow! Obama service is very good, the food is also very good! We have a very happy family!
My family and I had an AMAZING experience here. The food was delicious, abundant, and well-priced. We also loved meeting Jay, who was our server for the meal. He was very helpful, friendly, and kind.

Multiple side dishes. Unlimited. Good variety of choice meats. The only drawback is they like to cook your meat. So they are constantly walking by and adjusting  and flipping your meats. The bad thing is they use same tongs  for  raw and cooked especially with the chicken !  We always ask for a second pair. We go at least once a month!

Best quality and service. Price is about the same on the strip but I love that it's close to my house. 
We had the marinated platter perfect choice for party of 2-3

After a long Saturday of working, running errands & shopping. We decided to try out Goong because I had it bookmarked for awhile and heard about it through my Korean friends.

Upon entering the restaraunt we were greeted with a warm "ann-yeong-hasayo," Hello in Korean and slight bow. First impression was the formality of the staff and the ambience of the restaraunt. It was very modern and classy compared to other Korean restaraunts in the valley. Seating arrangement was a cool aspect of Goong, allowing you to enjoy a meal on the floor with more of a traditional flare or the option of being seated at regular table. Our server for the evening was, Jun. He was very friendly and knowledgeable with the menu. His service left a lasting impression on us. If you ever get the chance to try this place out. I reccomend him as a server. 

Now on to the food, this is was something we were not accustomed to since most of our experience with Korean BBQ is usually AYCE, with the exception of Hobak which is why I haven't got around to writing a review for Hobak yet. The reason is because I wanted to compare 2 of the most popular Korean BBQ restaraunts in Vegas. 

We opted for the Beef Platter which was good for 2-3ppl. From the very first pieces to the end was simply delicious. The quality of each meat was seasoned just right especially the Bulgogi. However I really enjoy the Prime Flat Iron and Prime Rib Eye. Those cuts of meat were juicy and flavorful especially when paired with the dipping sauce that was provided. The variety of banchan(side dishes) were fresh and delicious. We also got the Kimchi Fried Rice and that was very good with a perfect balance of spices and heat. 

Overall we had great time! By far the best Korean Restaraunt in Las Vegas!  / Thank You Jun and the staff of Goong for a cool experience!

The meat quality is awesome and the service is very good. I love the booth option because you feel more authentic that way. There are many combinations that you can choose from. We always get the beef platter and it's always fantastic and fresh.

I love trying new Korean barbecue restaurants. This is not an AYCE joint so I expect the need to be top quality. The prices are reasonable. The side dishes they give you are plentiful. However, in my opinion the meat tasted bland. 

Maybe it's just me but I love marinated meat. Our server asked how we liked our meat cooked and of course we said medium rare. Our first batch of me the server put on the grill was over cooked. So then for all the other meats we kept a closer eye. 

Then they changed the grill for our bulgogi and a lot of that got stuck on the grill. Maybe they need to grease it a little?

This is a nice restaurant however I wouldn't come back here. The AYCE place next to Monta is better and way cheaper.
Great price great servings and great atmosphere. Comparable to Hobak. Was a bit skeptical at first because I'm used to AYCE. Food was enough to feed 5 people.

I have just recently started eating Korean BBQ and I love it! This place was really cool as we walked in we saw big tables with places for you to take off your shoes before seating down. But we where directed to sit in a booth off to the side, there was only two of us. We went in around 2pm place was empty but food was so good and service was too. We order the prime rib, tenderloin, and the brisket.  We got every side in the world it felt like and the server described everything very well!  She also cooked all the meat for us which was nice, and the meat looked so beautiful before cooked like super fresh.  After the food was done and we had finished eating she brought out some cinnamon tea, to help digest all the food she said, it was so good! And I don't really like tea so I was surprised! Our total before tip was $44 which was very reasonable considering we had a ton of really good food! We will be back!

I really dislike many Korean restaurants in Vegas, but this one is my all time favorite. Whether it's the BBQ or just the traditional Korean dishes, everything is great. Plus, you get a shit load of side dishes that I never finish. I don't know what it is about this place the presentation and the food taste great.
This place is the best!!  Great food!  Great service. Junhee is the best!  He cooked our food to perfection and made sure that we knew what is being cooked on the table. We are sure to come back!
We went there for an adult mixer with our HOA. The food was very good. The waiter was attentive and helpful. I would go back.
This place offers good service and food at a reasonable price. The restaurant is very tidy and clean.
Excellent Korean BBQ. The service and the food were excellent. We had the marinated shirt rib, pork belly and brisket. My fave is brisket. Very flavorful and I would come back next time I visit

Love finding new place kbbq to add into rotation, especially since it's in a different area of town compared to my other favorites. 

I was a little disappointed in the flavor of the bean paste soups...that's one of my fav parts of kbbq and it didn't compare, still good tho 

All the meat was nice and fresh. The short rib was my favorite and like butter in our mouths. I definitely prefer the marinated meats. 

We unintentionally went on a Tuesday when they were having a all day deal(offered Wednesday's as well)

There's is lots of parking outside and a ton of seating inside. They have booths available as well as sit down booth where you enjoy your meal from a cushion with your shoes off
It seems to have gone down hill with less emphasis on the Gastro and more on the pub. It's a shame because the food can be great. Here hoping it was just an off night.
Went here during dinner time around 6ish and got a table right away.   All the beef meats were good.  The services were friendly and nice.
Lots of side dishes.  The meat we ordered were seasoned well.  Good quality and the place is cute.  My friend's referral.   We'll return for sure.

I love Japanese and Korean BBQ, or should I say meat. The interior reminded me of Gyukaku, except Goong is sexier. 

....I will keep my review short n' sweet. I asked for some recommendation and got the following:

Pork jowl/pork toro $12
Wagyu Short Plate (Wagyu Kalbi) $11
Bulgori (Marinated thinly sliced ribeye) $11 

I would say pork toro and wagyu beef were my favorites. Wagyu kalbi is a good deal for 5-6oz of meat at $11. Pork toro had lots of fat which I don't mind at all. If anything, I would use the term "juicy" instead of "fatty." Bulgogi is too sweet for me so that was a pass for me. 

Lots of banchan and all were great. Nicely done bathroom also. I would come back again.

Great kbbq. Love that they cook it for you and explain everything. Good quality fresh food at a good price. We got the pork combo for $45 and it was a tremendous amount of food with all the side dishes and 6 kinds of pork plus several mushrooms. Excellent service too

Has to be the best korean BBQ in Las Vegas. It has a much more luxurious vibe than Hobak and in my opinion - service is much better. Overall ambience is a lot nicer at Goong as well. Goong is more authentic and the side dishes are on point. How can you not have radish wraps at Hobak and still consider that place? Plus, the wait is a lot more agreeable at Goong. Overall, we've been to Hobak twice and Goong 4 times now -- and we are never going back to Hobak.

Ambience: amazing! Such a fun beautifully decorated place. It really adds something special to your experience there.

Service: sorry to say but kind of slow  I had to ask for water three times, and we weren't approached for almost ten mins. But it was a busy day for Father's Day so understandable 

Food: amazing! This is not a standard AYCE kbbq place.  You order a package, where it is priced at a certain amount, and they suggest how many people it feeds. You can also buy a plate of meats individually. The quality was so good, the meat was tender and tasty. A bit pricey, but the food will def meet your standards.
Make sure to ask your server to bring a grill to put over the grill it already is set as, the oil kept popping up on me and hurt super bad until they brought out the extra grill

Goong Korean BBQ - Las Vegas (2017 Yelp Review #250)

The southwest is blowing up big time.  Goong Korean BBQ is a great alternative to Chinatown's busy KBBQ joints.  The food at Goong KBBQ is fabulous and there's never a wait.  All meats are cooked by the staff (not you) and everything is awesome.  Their marinated sliced rib eye, prime brisket, and the Wagyu top sirloin ranks as my favorites.  If it's just me and Terri, we're almost always ordering the Beef Platter ($65 serves 2-3).  We recently dined here for dinner and because we had a pork lover with us, we got the Beef & Pork Platter ($85 serves 4-5).  The entire meal was awesome and a ton of ban chan also came with the meal.  Other highlights include their fish cakes, the seafood pancake, and of course, the steamed egg. The BBQ is not AYCE, but the servings of meat is generous enough to fill up your belly.

Very solid Korean BBQ. My only standard is Hobak, because I'm new to the K BBQ scene and I'm not sure it's fair to compare the two but life's not fair.  The food was great.  We shared the Goong Special Platter - Waygu everything, short ribs, shrimp.  Incredibly tender but not pre-marinated so not as flavorful as I like.  Unlike Hobak, Goong seems to focus more on the sides (13 in total) and less on the meat.  I'm typically looking for the meat sweats when I have Korean BBQ.  

Service was attentive, if not overly friendly. My only real complaint is that there is no ambiance. It's very antiseptic, like eating in a fluorescent-lit cafeteria.  We had a group of 7 and reserved a booth so we could have back support. If you don't wear orthotics, you might be interested in the cute little tables you sit around cross-legged and perhaps the ambiance is a little better over there.  If you are in the neighborhood, Goong is worth a trip.

Good food and prices.  Seemed like a one man operation, though.  The same host took our drink order, then disappeared. then came back and wanted to take our dinner order before bringng the drinks.

When the food was delivered, the same guy also bbqd the food at the table.

So much to do for one person that I can understand his occasional frustration, but, geez, get yourself some help.  We had to try saving our prime and waygu meats from overcooking while he was busy at another table.  I dinged them one star for that, and I may have been generous.

The Kloud beer may be my frst Korean beer.  I was impressed.

Was about to go Soyo when I passed this place and it caught my eye. After reading the reviews of this place, it seemed like a legit place for some good KBBQ. I didn't have expectations that it will surpass Kang Hodong in LA, but was expecting at least close in par with Hobak here in town. The bonchon was superb, they brought over 16 different items, and all of them more or less is very good. No complaints there. But unfortunately, that was actually the highlights of my time here.

We got the beef combo, which consist of 5 plates of meat. Each plate has a small amount, but the quantity even though not as much as Hobak, is more than enough for 2 and perhaps decent enough for even 3. The meat themselves all seemed high quality, they're all thinly sliced and looked fresh enough. However, it's not really about how good the meat is but it's how you cook it right? Out of my favorite places on the west coast, Kang Hodong in LA and Hobak in Vegas, they all cook for you, making sure you don't screw up the beautiful meat in the process. This place claimed to cook for you when I sat down, but they seem to leave for a long time after putting down the meat, and by the time they come back, the meat is already over cooked. It's not like it was crowded when I got there, there was only 1 other table at the time. I asked for medium rare, and the 1st 3 plates were all medium well to well done, which just in my experience ruin the reason to eat KBBQ. 

Also, unlike most other KBBQ places, this place use unmarinated meats. Most places I've had unmarinated meats have to be absolutely superb to pull it off. I went to this place in Matsuzakagyu Yakiniku M in Osaka, and they pulled it off perfectly. I don't think you can pull unmarinated meats unless you have the perfect meats, otherwise you should just stick to marinated meats. Hobak does not pretend that they have the perfect meats, and even with imperfect meats they manage to pull off amazing tastes. They also do better soybean paste soup and the steamed eggs. 

From the decor of this place, which mind you is VERY well done, to the unmarinated meats, to the service, I feel like this establishment is pretending to be something it's not. There's nothing that stands out either completely great or completely terrible about this place. However, I've definitely spent less money at other places for a more enjoyable KBBQ meal. It's a shame that my first experience wasn't a more satisfactory one, but I was certainly hoping it to surprise me. Perhaps my expectations were too high.
Really good quality of meat , friendly staff and clean environment ... Highly recommend

Las Vegas has seemingly always had buffets, and the norm for Korean BBQ has similarly been all you can eat. Fortunately, we now have multiple high-quality, non-AYCE KBBQ options including this one.

Goong Korean BBQ Restaurant is one of perhaps a triumvirate of (relatively) pricey, premium meat restaurants. Normally, I write about other businesses vaguely, but I'm going to refer to other restaurants by name, especially because I intend to draw some comparisons/contrasts with one of them in particular: Hobak. I have eaten there multiple times. I have not yet tried 8 Oz, the newest kid on the block. I have also eaten at Magal, which I consider to be a lower tier option and which i've only tried once, so I won't talk about them.

Perhaps the best part of the visit was how we were seated immediately at around 6:15pm on a Sunday night. Hobak always seems to have a long wait. The interior here is welcoming and feels more "traditional" in a way than that faux-street feel at Hobak. I also like the lantern-esque light covers with red and blue colors seemingly lifted straight from South Korea's flag. I'm told that those represent the ancient balancing forces of yin and yang.

Anyway, let's move on to the food. Rather than order a la carte, my two friends and I split a Marinated Meat Combination Platter ($65). We could've gone pricier, but we had a feeling that this would satiate our appetites, and it did. The meats did indeed all come marinated, but none of them tasted cheap - except perhaps the chicken, but nobody goes to KBBQ to eat chicken, right? Prime boneless short rib was highly marbled and easily tasted the best, but the thinly sliced rib eye, pork ribs, and pork outside skirt were delicious as well. Oh, and an employee cooked all of those for us. One difference from Hobak: no charcoal for added smoky flavor. Fortunately, I didn't miss that so much.

The combo comes with a steamed egg bowl and a choice of soup (one bowl). The steamed egg was as fluffy as hoped and was ideally salted. Our choice of soup was soft tofu (aka soondubu) and our protein choice for that was seafood. I can't remember tasting a cleaner broth in this type of soup before, which let the seafood flavors come out and play. The calamari was al dente but easily chewed apart, and the shrimp was cooked properly too. The tofu was soft. Surprisingly, this was my favorite soondubu in memory.

Side dishes were good if not great. I won't go all of through the banchan in detail because they were so numerous, but they all tasted fresh - y'know, crunchy when it was supposed to be and all that jazz. Seafood cakes (warmed on the grill) were quite good. The pink pickled daikon was surprisingly sweet. The japchae was great. The creamy dressing on the individual salads was not as heavy as anticipated.

Complimentary "dessert" was a cool (temperature-wise) bowl of cinnamon tea. It had some balanced sweetness and tasted like cinnamon, and it was surprisingly refreshing. (They do have options for ice cream and such if you're in the mood.)

Despite my initial concerns about cost, I'm glad that I finally heeded Desyree's advice (yes, that Desyree) and visited Goong. It impressed me with service, flavors, and relative affordability. I can't really pick a favorite between this and Hobak just yet, so if you haven't tried either of them, then try both.

Wow! This is by far the best Korean bbq I've ever been to. It's very nice inside with a floor pillow seating, table seating and private rooms. The cold barley tea wasn't for me but the table next to us wondered where they could buy it. We ordered the beef platter $65 which is 6 courses of beef and we added the shrimp $12-15. Everything was amazing, even the many side dishes. Kimchi fried rice was spicy but a delicious platter. 

4 stars due to the service. We arrived at opening, 11:30 with a reservation. It was our first time in and we were the second family through the door. We weren't offered any menu suggestions or even drinks. I finally had to stand to get attention to order. My husband insisted we leave like another table had as it had been 20 minutes with still no service. I counted 8 tables, most with the same issue. As the huge family of 6 left the only server on the floor stared the family down. Quite rude and unprofessional in my opinion. 

We will be back but we do highly suggest that if your charging good money (our bill was $97 before tip) you don't cheapen the experience with no staff. The entire two hours we were there we received no refills and asked for extra side dishes that never came. Two tables for this environment should receive one server. Two people for the entire place is ridiculous.

This place is the cream of the crop in Korean BBQ. I walk in and was surprised to find shoes on the side of almost ground level tables and customers sitting crossed legged, which is the traditional Korean style of eating. I sat at one of the side booths. Immediately we were told that it was not all you can eat. So we ordered the beef platter combo for a hefty $65. The side dishes, common with Korean food, was simply phenomenal. They served about 15 and literally covered our entire table. You also get a soup of choice. The meat choices were amazing! Flat iron steak, pork belly, thin brisket, etc, were all so tender and delicious that you forget about it not being all u can eat and delight in the high quality and service. I mean, someone made sure to turn our meats on the grill and even let us know when it was ready to eat. One would think you were at Benihana with your very own chef. Excellent, excellent, excellent service!!

One of the best kbbq places in southwest Las Vegas. Their quality of meat is excellent. The customer service is impressively top notch. I highly recommend ordering the wagyu top sirloin and ribeye. Their banchan is more diverse than some of the all-you-can-eat kbbq restaurants by comparison. We'll be back!

As much as I love the food and the place one of the waiters is very rude. We are regulars on this place we come as much as once a week. He gives you attitude, does not greet us and is mean. I think customer service should be a priority. Sadly they lost me as a client.

Went here last evening. The server barely spoke enough english to answer questions. I asked for non spicy soup and got something so spicy I spit it out. I asked the server why he told me the soup was not spicy and he said because it was not too spicy for him.  The food was delightful but the service made it not worth going back.

I really liked this place! Ambience is phenomenal! Place is very clean and appealing!  I really love the seating arrangement that they had where you remove your shoes and sit on the low bench like floor! Ordered beef platter for two, and the bibimbap! I will definitely go there again!

This place is fantastic! Beautiful decor and layout. I ordered the Wagyu combination. The meat was delicious and beautifully cooked by our waitress. She was very attentive and didn't make us feel uncomfortable like you might get as some places. The portion said 2-3 people, but we could have easily gotten away with 4 people and left full. We also got a side of the kimchi fried rice with steak (because we thought the combo might not be enough). We couldn't finish it, but I would have licked that plate clean.

I'll for sure be back! Maybe next time with more people.

First time here! Literally typing this review in while having a server cook me KBBQ. :D They start off with a plethora of side dishes - the usual kimchi, radish, two different salads, japchae, potato salad etc. You can choose to sit at a booth or the traditional style tables where you sit down on a pillow with no shoes on. They use 2 different grills depending in how the meat is seasoned. Definitely like the array of quality meats they have here - I ordered the Beef & Pork Platter - and I'm in love with their brisket! I am usually not impressed with pork belly in most kbbq places, but Goong surprisingly had theirs rather juicy and moist without seasoning. Service is definitely on point, most of the servers were generally male and cooked all the meat in a prompt and proper fashion. It was a nice touch having green tea salt as one of the seasonings, I really liked that as I am a fan of anything green tea lol. My friend also noticed that they were playing instrumentals from the Spirited Away soundtrack in the background, which really made my night as it gave a nice bonus to the neutral but grounded ambiance they had at Goong. :) Will definitely come again with friends and family! They'll be serving ice cream next week so for those with a sweet tooth check it out!

Quality food, service, and ambiance! I would take a picture but my hands were full with all the great side dishes and grilled meats. We love taking our out-of-town guests here to show we locals also have more nice places to go to off The Strip.

I love Korean BBQ but most of the places I've tried since my favorite place closed down a few years ago have sufficed....But this will be my new favorite place! The food is great, well seasoned and exactly how I like it! The restaurant is clean and trendy I will be a regular! It's a must try if you like this type of cuisine.

I like this place because it seems like you are entering an upscale Korean restaurant.  The staff delivers friendly service throughout our dining experience.  We never had to cook our food at our table. We ordered the $65 pork and beef combination for 3 people and it was perfect. The quality and taste of the meats were excellent.  We loved the side dishes because it was a delicious variety. 
Compared to Hobak which doesn't always cook your food, Magal which doesn't always cook your food, and Gen which has poor quality food, Goong is our favorite AYCE Korean BBQ in Vegas.
No added charges at the end unless it's for drinks is the best part of the dining experience.

Went to Goong last week.  It's a beautiful restaurant!  The quality of meat was great.  But when we first walked into the restaurant, we asked the host to seat our party at a regular table so that my husband's sore back could rest in a normal chair.  The host said ok, but continued to lead us to the traditional Korean tables saying that my husband could rest his back on the end booth of the traditional seating area.  He made us take off our shoes, as well, in order to sit in the traditional seating area.  Not wanting to be a downer to the party, we conceded.  However, the last thing I wanted to do right before I ate was touch my shoes.  Anyway, the wait staff was very nice and explained our cuts of meat.  However, I do not like having the waiters continuously interrupting our dinner conversations to explain the meat and cook it for us.  I prefer we cook it ourselves.  We will probably not go back.

I came back here for took gae jang. It's a gourmet version since it comes with kalbi meat instead of the shredded meats. The broth was mehhhhh, and I was not digging the flavors. 

Got a couple meats to try again, and the boneless short rib was amazing. It's super pricey, but it was enough food for two. The banchans are amazing here...they have nool kimchi (water kimchi) which was on point.

Came here by accident.   Our usual AYCE Kbbq turn us away because they weren't s3atibg anymore people.  So we saw this restaurant and thought we try it out.  The workers were very helpful,  and good service.   We got the Beef platter that feeds 2-3 people.  At first we thought it was not enough..but we guessed wrong.  It was alot of food and side dishes lol.  You can taste the quality in the meats they use.  So good.  We  definitely be back .
Got the combination platter. Great variety and the food and service was fantastic. Will definitely be back.

Our server HS Kim was awesome! The decor is so cute. Very Modern-chic! We have always been to all you can eat places but this....this is QUALITY! (Quality over quantity always) Everyone was so attentive and politely answered any questions that we had! 

My boyfriend and I got the beef platter and it was more than enough! 

We are definitely coming back!
The food is delicious but needs more organizing with the dishes. Everything is just placed somewhere with room and then as they cook, they move it around more
My first time here and I'll be back for sure. They offer so many different sides and I loved the bulgogi and short ribs.

Loved the decorations and the inside of the restaurant when I walked in. I wanted to sit in the middle on the floor but ended up just in the booth. Ordered the beef platter for $65. It was delicious. There were many delicious banchan. Everything was good. Definitely recommend and will come back. :-)

Good food and extremely reasonable pricing. Interesting atmosphere as the hip hop and pop music set the vibe a little "off" for me. Gracious and helpful staff. I would definitely go back. The thinly cut rib eye was delicious, and the unlimited sides were fun to explore.
Good food! This is a great place to bring the family to have dinner or lunch. Yummy in my tummy
Great service and great food!!! The meats are very fresh and tender...delicious.  One thing needs to improve is the side dishes, not much taste!

I originally first tried Korean BBQ in California and now I have a place that surpasses it! It is absolutely delicious and the service is wonderful. So much food at such an affordable price and every bit of it is so yummy. I would definitely suggest getting the Bulgogi beef and the prime chuck flat iron steak. Those are options you can never go wrong with. With this place being almost next door to work, I will definitely be back.
Really nice quiet place, good music good nice service, good quality beef love everything here its a place you would like to go again

I really like this place.  The portions are not super large, but definitely adequate.    Service was fast.  We ordered a group meal (beef) and it was very reasonable and enough for all.   Overall, it's a great place for Korean, with great staff and service.

Went there for lunch and food and service was so good that we went back again a week later for dinner. Big difference in service. The lunch crew service was much better!! Night crew on a Friday was already cleaning even though there was over an hour left before closing. It's not fun trying to eat when you see someone already mopping. Service is hit and miss.

Amazing food amazing service and quality of meat ! A must try ! We took the wagyu platter for 2, because it's not everywhere we can have that. It was 85$ and a lot of varieties of side dishes. I loved the fish cake and kim chi soup !!! Their are choices for seafood as well !
Great service! Amazing quality! Come here! High quality meats you will not be disappointed. Gen is good but the quality here is much better.
By far my favorite Korean BBQ restaurant anywhere.  The best ever. The ambiance is great and the staff is terrific.

Service is complete shit- like literally worst service ever. One guy literally shook his head and bitched about the customers coming in. Every person was rude and treated us like shit. We made a reservation in advance. Got there and they were going to sit us korean style when we requested booth when reserving 45 minutes prior. It was our first time there and it's pretty different from hawaii. We ordered the $145.00 meal with a variety of meats and shrimp. They didn't tell us that they cook or assist with cooking it so we started ourself - then a waiter came 20 mins later and asked if we wanted to cook it- when we were already cooking it.... with out oil or anything. We didn't know u use the slab of fat hidden under some other stuff on the tray... just over all shit experience. 
Luckily the food was pretty good and the ambience is nice . Not mind blown but decent quality- Not impressed enough to come back.

Awesome new Korean BBQ joint on our SW side! Love the cute seating area where you can sit on pillows and remove your shoes to have a more authentic feel. This is not an AYCE spot so our party chose the GOONG special on the menu which includes about 9 meat items such as wagyu beef, marinated short ribs, pork belly, and even tiger shrimp!! Feeds about 4-5 ppl and we still wound up taking plenty of food home. Presentation was wonderful. Restaurant is clean and decor is inviting. Everything was deliciously prepared and the staff is beyond attentive and helpful. All of the typical side dishes that come along with Korean restaurants were automatically included and those you can order as much as you want! Definitely will be back with a bigger appetite next time!!

Well the wife and I decided to expand our choices and visited Goong at 1pm, we had the pork platter wow lot of food. Very good soup with it and one of the better places for side dishes (hard to find in Vegas). They bring 3 types of pork, I could not finish the 1st serving of pork.
Good service. Love their side dishes, best of the best. Lunch specials only Mon to Fri

I was genuinely surprised at the quality and taste of the meats. They are the star of this place's show! We had the Beef & Pork Combination Platter for 6 of us and it was plenty. We are used to the all you can eat so portion control was definitely something different to get used to. Also our family likes our meats well done but they were fastidious about constantly removing and lowering the fire, again something to get used to.

This place was really good! We went on a recommendation from my best foodie yelp elite Korean friend so I figured it would be a good bet. The atmosphere wasn't my favorite (a little bright and sterile) but the food was good. They went buck wild on the sides with what we ordered (the pork and beef combo) such that our table didn't even fit everything. They had to stack some items on the top of our booth backs. It was awesome! Everything was super fresh and delicious. My favorite was the ribeye and pork belly (as usual) and honestly the only I didn't like were the marinated meats that ended the meal. The marinated beef was sooo sweet and the marinated pork was so flavored you vouldnt even taste the meat. That's just personal preference though. When I go back (and I definitely will) j will opt out of those meats and double up on something else. 

We had to ask for garlic and jalapeños and gochujang and sesame oil (again personal preference, but some places do bring it automatically) but they were more than happy to supply it. 

Overall a good experience. It doesn't hold a candle to Donday and Yakiniku Seoul in Waikiki but that's okay ;)

Their interior decor is really cute and have a section where you need to take off your shoes and sit on those pillows and become true Koreans. Should have tried it because we are probably not coming back since my sister had really bad food poisoning after we ate here. We have really strong digestive and immune system and it takes a lot to give us food poisoning. The food was average for a non-ayce place and I didn't like the black grill that they use because I feel like they cannot really clean it that well.
This was my first time trying Korean BBQ and it was absolutely delish! The service is really good. I will be coming back!
The most unique place in las vegas ! So delicious! The service is outstanding! The girl that i was on a date with here... literally, was blown away!!

Atmosphere: not traditional Korean BBQ feel. Almost a bit modern.

Service: wasn't the greatest but wasn't bad. They were friendly and attentive enough but also there were not many customers in the restaurant.

Food: food was good. Again not great. They did not explain anything that came with the meal. They bring out at least 6-8 bowls of different things inside and don't tell you what's what. Unless you've eaten Korean BBQ before you would have no idea what they are in those bowls.

Price: pretty comparable to other Korean BBQ restaurants in town. Maybe a bit pricier but it is worth it for where and how the restaurant looks.

Cleanliness: extremely clean again compared to other Korean BBQ restaurants in town that I have been to.

Quality: is good. Could provide a bit more meat for what you pay for but overall it's tasty.

Would recommend to others.

This is one of the few Korean BBQ located outside china town. The decor and atmosphere are very modern and sophisticated. When you enter the restaurant they give you the option to sit in a normal booth or in their traditional tables where you have to take your shoes off and dine on the floor. Their menu is pretty extensive. However, they have preset menus that can feed 4-6 people. I think the preset menus were the best options as you get a pretty good variety of meats. We ordered the Goong special which includes wagyu rib eye, wagyu sirloin, prime short ribs, wagyu chuck flat, marinated prime short ribs, black tiger shrimp and a lot of Korean sides. The quality of the meat is evident. The taste of the wagyu meat was very good. I especially liked the rib eye and the marinated prime short ribs. The service was just ok, the service was kind of slow and not very efficient. Also we had to be constantly asking to refill our side dishes as they were never offered to us. Overall, a good restaurant if you wanna have good quality meat and a great atmosphere.

This place is very good sometime i want to eat korea food
so i was finding some korea restaurants than i found this restaurant i have ordered kimchi soup and Bulgogi 
I was amazing.. when i ate I thought my mom's food

Probably the best Korean personal table smokeless grill BBQ (Gogigui) in Las Vegas! The place is very clean and new. The service is 5 stars along with the quality of the meat (the meat comes with labels in case you forget). It was very well presented. The servers would help cook your meat along with quickly doing several grill changes. It was not smokey like some of other Korean BBQ joints.

This was my first experience with Korean food and it will not be my last. The restaurant itself is really nice inside, very cool vibe. This restaurant is extremely family friendly, and all of our kids had a wonderful experience. The food was fantastic. Being new to the cuisine, we tried some of everything. All of the different meats, and different condiments and seasonings, every bite was a new delicious flavor. And the noodle salad... To die for.  It's a must have!! The peach Soju was delicious as well. This is now one of my regular spots to bring my family.
I like the decoration of the restaurant and they have very fresh meat. There are around 10 side dishes which you could try all different kinds of Korean food. Great taste!
First time having Korean BBQ ... Couldn't have picked a better place for a rookie's first time.  Thank you Goong, your service was awesome!

BS +++
This is not an AYCE location which is new for me since I'm used to NYC Korean bbq locations to be almost buffet style.  I been to Gen here in Vegas and it wasn't that impressive.
This fufu-modern Jap-Korean bbq spot is the bomb.  The chic layout is definitely a plus as you walk in.   They have benches with cute pillows you can relax on Japanese style or you can ask for the a nice booth seating.  They wait staff are very attentive and super nice.  I love how they cook for you to ensure meat is not overcooked.  We ordered the beef bbq platter (it looks small but it's a lot), Pork belly, sirloin and green tea and strawberry ice cream mochi.  The barrage of side dishes was a lot and they even gave three rice bowls.  I didnt think it was a lot but for $133 it was a steal.  They even offered a cinnamon green tea sweet drink on the house.  The experience was fun especially the clubby music they were playing but not that loud that you had to scream at each other.  The lighting was bright that you didn't have to squint while searching for cooked meat.  The meat was fresh and clean.  Nothing looked old or marinated to the point that you couldn't tell if the meat was fresh.  Overall it was a great filling experience.  I would highly recommend this place to any foodie.  Be forewarned it is still a Korean bbq spot.  So don't wear your nice clothes that you don't want to smell like meat for weeks.  I don't just endorse spots for freebies.  So come down to this beautiful strip of stores and eat S Rainbows legit good eats.


Location is CLEAN, PROFESSIONAL. ORGANIZED
Staff are COURTEOUS, FRIENDLY, CALMING, PROFESSIONAL
Parking lot is SHARED but SPACIOUS
Restrooms DID NOT GO IN
Food WAS AMAZEBALLS!
