Great Ambience, very excellent service.
Try to get the raised seating tables in the middle.

This place is really good. Although it's not all you can eat, the cut of the meat is so tender.  The servers made sure we didn't cook our own food & my cup was always full. The table was always clear of unwanted plates & they made sure to check up on us. 
Food was great, service was great. I highly recommend this place. Just a little on the pricey side but they have lunch specials
Excellent experience there. The staff couldn't be more friendly and professional. Food was great!!! Don't take my word for it....try them out.

Amazing! the service is exceptional.  The menu is a little on the smaller side but they have a ton of wagyu options- if that's what you're into. Seafood supplements. Ton of bonchon. And GOOD bonchon. The shrimp were HUGE. The short ribs were nothing short of amazing.  There are only a few options for combination platters so I could see it getting pricey if you wanted to add other meats to a combo- but you get what you pay for, right? The spicy tofu soup that came with our combo even came with a choice of meat- it was HEAVEN. 

The manager and (I believe) the owner checked on us during dinner and even gave my kids a free dessert! I can't speak enough to the amazing customer service!

This place is incredible!   We saw the reviews and decided to try it out.  The restaurant is beautiful.  We decided to try the beef combination platter and it did not disappoint.  Amazing prime rib, beef tenderloin, wagyu beef, and prime cut chuck fat -- delicious!!!!  The small side veggie and Korean appetizer dishes are an awesome compliment to the array of amazing meat.   Thank you for a wonderful experience in Vegas!  We'll definitely be back.
good meats, could use some seasoning, lots of good sides, good service. little pricy for amount of meats.
Fancy brand new kbbq place. Good choice to hang out there with your friends on weekends night.

Twice we had the beef and the beef/pork special. With all of the extras it was all that the four of us could eat. Lots of food for the price. Only draw back was charged extra for a second portion of rice. No other Korean type establishment has ever done this. Will definently return with out of town guests. Have already referred several others that enjoy this type cuisine.

Me and my gf found this restaurant online and decided to give it a try because we have been meaning to get to know Las Vegas and all it's food! 

First of all I've eaten at a lot of different Kbbq places especially in his area and by far the cuts of meat, quality of service, atmosphere and seating were all at a great standard for my picky attitude.

Pricing is a little more expensive than most KBBQ places but once you take your seat you will realize why. 

If you are looking to have a nice anniversary or family celebration I would do this as long as your willing to pay for it :)

No. 1 stupid rule...
I wanted the tofu bimbimbap, hubby is having tiger shrimp.... Except that we couldn't order both because we both have to have a BBQ dish... But if we sat separately, we can order anything we want... 
We don't eat meat..... WTH?
I went there the day after to order bimbimbap tofu to take out... They don't do take out orders either.... ISad....
Was told about this place by a coworker and had to try it. Food was definitely amazing and I'll for sure come back. Ask for Jun... very informative!!!
Great place to eat!!!  First time actually having real Korean Food and it was amazing!  also great atmosphere!

We came here around 1pm in search for some great Korean BBQ and we found it.  This is a MUST TRY if you are in the area.

Decor and ambiance is amazing.  You have the option of the common tables with grills, floor seats where you have to off your shoes, and a separate area for larger groups.

In terms of the service, they were very friendly, knowledgeable and attentive to our needs.  We were greeted and seated immediately upon entering.  

Menu has a wide variety of options.  Lunch was available (until 4pm) when we came in but we wanted to try one of the platters.  We ordered the beef platter and terms of the quantity it was more than enough for 3 people.  My favorite cuts were prime rib eye and marinated rib eye.  It also came with tons of sides which probably were the best I have ever had. 

Parking might be an issue especially on a weekend because of the amount of spaces and restaurants located in the vicinity.  But if you go early I doubt it would be a problem. 

Overall the service, food, and ambiance is excellent!  Can't wait to come back and try everything else on the menu.

Everything was very good, and service was amazing. The only thing I though was just "ok" was some of the sides, such as the sweet mashed potato that was pretty tasteless. Other than that meats were excellent. I do recommend.

For a party of 2, we spent about $70 altogether here. Everything is a la carte or they have combo sets. Servers there could definitely take a lesson in being friendlier. Not sure if place settings were wrong or if you really need to ask for it, but we didn't have any napkins at our table or plates to put our food on to eat from nor did any of the 5 servers that helped us notified that. Thank goodness the food was good and that is why it's deterring me from giving it less stars. Beef tongue was amazing. Super tender. Marinated kalbi was pretty good as well, definitely on the fattier side though. Sirloin steak was very good! Make sure you cook it medium rare though. I wasn't too impressed with the pork jowl. Although it was tender and juicy, it was too thin and had too much fat on it. I prefer hobak's pork jowl. Loved how much banchan they had. Mul nengmyeon was a bigg portion. I liked how it stayed cold for so long. I would come back for it again. This place can definitely accommodate big and also private parties as well. Great place to come eat with friends and family.

One of the best korean restaurant i've ever been to!!
Fresh meat...friendly servers
All i gotta say is meaaat
I love their side dishes there! They give you a lot which is good since the meat there are a little pricy. I also like their lunch special as well. Reasonable price.
First time at a Korean BBQ joint, everything was explained to us so we weren't totally overwhelmed. Amazing food, great service. Will absolutely be back!

This place is pretty darn good!  It's so close to the house too, which is a huge plus!  I like the decor in this place, it wasn't what I expected on the outside.  It feels zen. 

We came in one night about an hour and half before they were going to close.  There were about 3-4 tables.  Not so busy.  They had use wait about 10 minutes to setup a table.  When we got the table, it wasn't setup.  So they just had us wait for 10 minutes and then wait again for our table to setup while we were there.  Not sure why it doesn't seem like anyone wanted to take our table.  Took a while for someone to came and take our order.  I'm only thinking in my head, this place better be good, because service isn't here.  We didn't feel so welcome.  Finally they took our order and our order came out shortly after that.  Now all a sudden the staff comes and seem like they're rushing us eat.  Consistently cooking our meat when we haven't started eating the one on the grill.  I dislike people doing that, it makes people feel rush.  People like to enjoy their food and have a nice conversation.  

Hobak or here.  I have to say Hobak.  There's just something about the service and the quality of meat they serve there. 

We'll have to come back and try it again.  Might had been their off night.  =)
First time here. So delicious. Gil's customer service was great. Very attentive and friendly. Everyone else was great too. Good quality of meat too.

Moon is an amazing server. She gave us all the information we needed. I had visitors come from out of town and they loved her. I feel like she made this a great visit for my friends who came into town. My water was NEVER not full.

I visited two Korean bbq places one day apart and it was my first time at a Korean bbq. This was the second place I tried. This place was a lot more upscale. They had high quality meats here. Swanky.   The easiest way to describe the ambiance and what sets this KBBQ joint apart from its competitors.  From glass cases showcasing their beef to thick cut, glistening pink, raw cuts being presented on synthetic black stone slabs.  The design focuses all the attention on the food you're about to cook.

IMPORTANT, Goong advertises two types of beef, Wagyu and Prime.  To avoid disappointment understand Wagyu is a breed of cow not an indicator of quality.  The wagyu breed It is characterized by sweet flesh capable of achieving extremely fine marbling.  "Prime" denotes USDA prime and DOES reflect the marbling regardless of the breed.   Not all Wagyu is USDA Prime or higher.  Choose your cut based on the flavor you want to enjoy.

Tip:  Opt for a set.  Sets include all the banchan (including a salad), steamed egg, a choice of soup for the table and a good cross selection of their proteins.  Add additional proteins ala carte if you think you need more food.  A few mushrooms are provided for grilling.  No additional veg.

Standard KBBQ cuts.  Beef cut thicker than most places the quality very good (USDA choice or higher).  Pork has a good amount of fat that crisps up nicely.  Marinades tend to be on the sweet side.  Regardless of set, be sure to order some pork jowl.  Sweet, porky goodness.   Beef lovers, it's all about the wagyu short plate.  Lots of internal fat.  Sweet beefy goodness.

Unlike most KBBQ places, you are in full control of your grill.  Servers will offer to help to start you off but thereafter, it's all you.  

KBBQ is stepping up its game in Vegas and Goong is right at the forefront.

Items Selected:

Chadolbagi - Thinly Sliced Prime Brisket
Galbi - Marinated Prime Short Rib

Dolsot Bibimbap - White Rice, Stir-fried Vegetables, Marinated Beef, Fried Egg, Spicy Sauce
Tteok Manduguk - Soup with Rice Cakes and Dumplings in Beef Stock

Not one for all-you-can-eat restaurants, especially the sort where "cooking your own food" is considered the norm, it was with hopes of dispelling such misconceptions that a seat was taken at Goong Korean BBQ on South Rainbow, two friends with far more experience at such places providing great conversation and a whole lot of education during the meal's nearly-two hour span.

Considered to be one of the city's more authentic experiences, shoes removed and decorative-pads provided for seating at one of several gas-fired grilltops, those arriving at Goong during lunch hours are likely to be struck by the tranquility of a space devoid of televisions or elaborate decorations, the clean lines complimented by a light soundtrack as servers provide menus and beverages while speaking in hushed tones.

Offering several lunch specials alongside the dinner menu, a la carte Meats as well as party-sized Combos offered alongside a variety of Soups and Rice plates, it was with both Korean and English descriptions that choices spread across several pages, the ordering deferred to others with some input as to a Rice Cake Soup and Pork Jowls that sounded particularly interesting.

Partially familiar with the format, a plethora of small bowls and plates quickly flooding the table prior to the first Meat selection, it was with small bites tasted of each Banchan that the palate was prepared for the flavors to follow, the Fish Cakes and Spicy Eggplant particularly memorable as makeshift appetizers while choices like the pickled Daikon, Onions and Soy Noodles were better utilized with the Proteins, or at least as palate cleansers between bites.

Turning focus now to the grill, a total of three Meats ordered with a second helping of Galbi proving far superior to the sinewy first round, those making their first visit to Goong would be well advised to order at least one plate of the thinly-sliced Chadolbagi that cooks through in under two-minutes as well as a Pork plate, the glass cases in back proudly displaying the sort of quality worth paying for as each is sliced to order in a nothing-to-hide way.

Not one for really hot stuff, even Goong's Kimchee a bit too heated if not taken with some rice, additional plates tasted included the Cold Buckwheat Noodle Salad served with Soy and lava-red Sauce as well as the comforting Dolsot Bibimbap, a large bowl of Tteok Manduguk presented last with Salt and Pepper by a server who all but admitted gauging his table's "whiteness" even though the overstuffed Dumplings in Beef Stock were already savory enough.

***  An enjoyable meal as much for the company as for the food, Goong Korean BBQ proved a nice introduction to a new genre, though the service did feel slightly judgmental throughout the course of the afternoon while prices trend higher than would be anticipated for several of the dinner Rice Bowls, Soups and Casseroles.  Also, Mochi is not dessert...

Restaurants all over the place throw around the words "wagyu" and "Kobe" these days and it confuses consumers.  It gives the false idea that some rural farmer in Japan prepared this majestic, gently massaged, beer-fed cow specifically for their plate.  Because of the lack of uniform rules on beef labeling, this happens regularly with zero repercussions to them.  They can say anything they want!  You think video poker bars in Vegas really have authentic wagyu beef in the form of sliders ready to be served at 2am for $10?  It's a name that catches the eye and allows them to charge more.  Just like "super white tuna".  

American tastes have come a long way from when lean meats were king.  They currently take a backseat to pork belly, the "more white than red" beef and even chicken thigh.  I didn't ask about the origins of Goong's product, or if they had any concrete proof that it was truly wagyu, but their quality is clearly a step above the standard Vegas KBBQ and that makes it worth going to in my book.  

To shorten time perusing the menu for our party of 5, the Goong special at $145 was the easiest way to sample it all.  This included a nice selection from pork jowl to prime flat iron to wagyu top sirloin.  The ribeye and short rib were my personal favorites and met all my criteria for great grilled beef, which is FJT (fatty, juicy, tender).  I enjoy a little blood, so no piece stayed on the grill for long.

I am normally not very sensitive about service (perhaps all those Chinese restaurants I went to growing up dulled my senses), but the rushed, stop-go service left something to be desired.  I'd prefer the servers either put the meat on the grill and see it through to its completion, or leave us alone to do it all.  There was one point where a gentleman placed a nice looking piece over the fire, asked my friend if she liked her beef cooked "medium", she responded "yes" and then he proceeded to walk away from the table!  What did that mean? Was he coming back to flip it or leaving that up to us?  Should we just put more on the grill when we're done?  They make such an effort to present the meat so royally with the thick, uniform, labeled cuts in a classy and quiet dining atmosphere; it's a shame that this was the problem.  They were also more reactive than proactive when it came to refilling banchan as we always had to ask about getting something instead of them noticing the empty bowl and asking if we wanted more.  That's all fixable though.      

Constantly losing track of which cuts were being eaten, which I blame on attempting to be social (ha), made some of the meat feel a little less special.  "Wait.  What cut is this again?" was said numerous times.  Maybe I need flashing lights that say the name of the meat.  Regardless, I'll be back here to satisfy my fix of good marbled beef. 3.6511111 stars.

First Impression: I've been waiting for this place to open after driving by its fancy exterior signage many times. With all the KBBQ restaurants in town, this one definitely stole the spotlight. I finally got the chance to try this place and upon entering, I was fascinated by their interior design from the layout to the decorations of sculptures, mirrored vents, high ceiling and etc. My friend and I came here for dinner around 7pm and there were a plenty of seating available. We had the option of sitting at a booth OR, the traditional Korean seating where you take off your shoes and sit on these large blue pillows. Of course we went with the traditional way to get the full experience!

Food: We weren't super hungry so we decided to order a la carte but they do have party platters recommended for the size of your group. We ordered the prime rib eye, beef tongue (x3) and thinly sliced brisket (x2). They serve 14 banchans (side dishes) naming each one as its being served and barley tea instead of water that is light with a hint of roasty flavor. I would drink this over water any day because it's so refreshing! Your dipping choices are green tea salt (my favorite out of the 3 and super delicious paired with meat), regular salt with pepper and a dark sauce. Some of the meat is served on a black slate which adds a unique touch. The meat portion is quite small and the price is on the pricier side but seeing the quality, color and cut of the meat is definitely worth it!

Service: Everyone was super friendly and attentive. The servers were patient and cook for you all the way through for each meat which was nice. Sometimes I just prefer to cook it myself so I can eat and chat since having them cook in between us gets kind of awkward. One thing to point out is that they don't serve us individual plates. After the meat was cooked, they move it to the side of the grill and we had no plates to hold the meat except eating off of the grill. There was also no napkins to be found. We were always checked up on except it gradually slowed when the dining area got busier which was understandable. 

Overall, I enjoyed my experience here at Goong. It is a nice place to take friends and family to for the finer dining KBBQ experience than the typical places around Chinatown. I will come back and order the party platters next time to try out all the different kinds of meat they offer!

We enjoyed our dinner here.  We weren't expecting the restaurant to be so authentic.  It's was a nice experience.  We ordered the $65 Beef platter combo. Everything was good, except for the male server who is a bit snooty. He would shove all the serving plates and bowl the women's side of the table.
Clean and nice restaurant. The servers grill pretty much everything for you on your grill so you don't really have to do much.  Prices aren't too bad.  No complaints.

Came here to see what all the hype was about....delicious!!!

Meat was high quality and fairly priced for the portions you get. I recommend the wagyu brisket! Also, I don't know how long they'll keep it up but the wine is half priced bottles currently. 

Ambience and decor was great. Grill was well ventilated and I didn't smell like BBQ afterwards. 

Will definitely come back again.

This place had a 4.5 star average, when Honey Pig elsewhere in town only has 3 stars, so I decided to give it a try--a horrible decision.

Upon sitting down, I overheard other customers speaking in Japanese, which gave me high hopes. I read through the menu, which had English/Romanized text, Hangul, Japanese, and ...I believe Cantonese. It may have been Simplified Chinese but I cannot remember. One section of the menu... perhaps the standard Barbecue section... had one sentence explanations of the order in English. A different section, the Marinated Barbecue section, had one line explanations in Hangul. This inconsistency troubled me.

Before we decided on our order, the busman who seemed very happy with his job was cleaning the table opposite ours. Each platter he emptied out and replaced in his cart produced a loud, obnoxious clunk. Perhaps this means the hardware is of good quality.

We attempted to order lunch specials, but because we were dining on Sunday afternoon, we could not order the Monday through Friday lunch specials. Instead, we ordered the beef short rib (kalbi) and bulgogi from the normal menu.

Because Goong is a normal Korean BBQ restaurant without an all you can eat menu, comparing volume is USUALLY out of the question. However, this only holds true when the a la carte location provides quality tiers above the smorgasbord option.

The appetizers came in plenty, as I expected. However, I did not expect to receive five different types of radishes, accounting for more than half the plates. My sub claims the kimchi was good. I dislike chili so I didn't try it. We agreed despite coming in spicy, shaved, sour, pickled, and grated varieties, the different forms of radish did not fulfill our appetizer demands. The remaining appetizers included spicy toufu, sesame oil noodle (I forget the name,) salt and pepper salad, and some kind of mashed potatoes. I expected something including fish or egg, but nothing of the sort arrived.

The white rice came in a small bowl. I remembered seeing "Extra Rice ... 2" on the menu, and my heart sinking at the thought. The meat also came in small, but reasonable amounts. You are paying about eight or nine times as much for the meat here as you are at the supermarkets down the street, but they marinated it for you and included a lot of appet...radish. They will also turn the grill on for you, place the meat on it for you, and repeatedly come to turn the meats over and cut it into bite size pieces for you, even if you have gigantic mouths and prefer five times the bite size they cut, like me. They will turn the grill off for you before the meat is well done.

The bulgogi was ... bulgogi. The marinade was fairly weak, but tastable. The meat quality was good, a little bit better than Honey Pig. The kalbi was an interesting cut--unlike the multi-bone with bone fragment hell you get any other place you order kalbi, it was one rib, and the slices of meat above it. The marinade was ... almost absent, but I THINK it was marinated in something. Perhaps it was just the remaining drip from the bulgogi, I am not sure.

At this stage of the meal, we were slowly becoming radish, when I ran out of rice. My heart sank as it remembered the number two and my eyes tried to justify its connection to the small bowl of rice, but luckily the radish across from me let me have the remaining rice. With it, I managed to finish off the meats to perfect my meat-radish balance.

In the end, there is no reason not to drive the extra miles to go to Honey Pig and eat slightly lower quality food (with better selection and, last I checked, 24 hour operation) and get more satisfaction for your pennies.  I will next try Doh down the street, no matter what Yelp says about it.

We paid the check, and on the way out I greeted the hostess with a prominent and thankful "Xiexie!" and left, never to return.

The meats were amazing, I would rate the meat 5 stars. The waiters in the other hand are a -5 stars. The place was almost empty when my party arrived and they were all immediately in a rush. My phone was on a menu, when I suddenly hear a loud bang on the table. One of the waiters slid my phone off the menu and walked away. They move everything to be able to reach the meats in the most careless manner. The meats kept falling off the grill and they would just put them right back on. I would recommend to train their waiters better manners or just simply stop having them cook the meats for you because they obviously cannot seem to get that right.
Great bbq place will def be here again.  The meat was excellent quality and the service was solid! Our new go to Korean bbq when in Vegas

Really great korean bbq place. Definitelly coming back!Service was quick & helpful - they answered our questions & Ji Hoon was a great waiter!! Very impressive selection of side dishes & the meat definitely was savory.

It's still my favorite. We ordered the pork platter, the pork toro was excellent, great texture and flavor. And the the server did and great job cooking the pork belly, nice and crispy outside and tender inside.

My husband and I checked this place out because of the great reviews and it did not disappoint at all. We ordered the bibimbap and bulgogi specials and it was delicious. The staff were friendly and very efficient.

Food: I think the lunch specials here are worth the money. It's a lot of food for roughly $15. I ordered the beef bulgogi + naeng myeon (cold noodles). It was really hot that day so the cold noodles hit the spot. I just didn't like how the egg yolk was over cooked, but that's just my preference. 

Service: the servers there are really nice and checked up on us quite a few times. 

Atmosphere: the restaurant is really big. There's special traditional style seating in the middle of the restaurant and they also have private rooms for parties. The decor feels modern and the restaurant is also very clean.

My mother and I checked this place out based on a friend's recommendation, and they did not disappoint! We were used to going to All You Can Eat KBBQ places, but this definitely was a grade above those other types of places. 

When you first walk-in, the ambience is beautiful! There is a combination of tables where you take off your shoes to sit down or regular seating. Everything was very clean.

My mother and I ordered the Beef Plater Combination (good for 2-3 people) which consisted of Prime Rib Eye, Wagyu Top Sirloin, Prime Chuck Flat, Prime Flat Iron, Thinly Sliced Prime Brisket, and Marinated Thinly Sliced Ribeye (bulgogi). This platter also came with a steamed egg and your choice of soup. The platter also came with a LOAD of sides, you can probably get full of them, but we paced ourselves to ensure we would be able to try everything. 

Needless to say, everything was delicious! The quality of the meats were great! We ate our meal by each type of meat in order to appreciate each type of meat. Halfway through the meal, the grill was changed to cook the brisket and ribeye. 

The staff top to bottom was great! There was always a different staff member serving our food, offering to cut or grill the meats, or accommodating any of our other requests. There was no one that gave us a bad experience. 

There are many other dishes that give us lots of reason to come back, and my mom and I certainly will!

Clean and inviting environment. This is Not an "all you can eat" Korean BBQ. We ordered the Wagyu beef. I enjoyed all the side dishes. The beef was amazing. Very tender. Everything was delicious and fresh.
The service was great and food was excellent. They really know what they're doing. The presentation of all the meats was beautiful. We also love that it's close to home.

Take away:
A place you'll share with friends. 

1. Ambiance:
I always start how a place makes me feel when I walk in and the first thing you'll notice is that it's beautiful. Rainbow Blvd has become Vegas' hotspot for Asian concepts and Goong has set a new bar. If you're from Vegas, you've come to accept the mini-mall as our neighborhood landscape. Used to be that when you have relatives or friends visit, you'd bring them to the Strip. Seriously, options have swung open. You can tell design is important to Goong--I'll take my wife to a date, co-workers for lunch, even client meetings and won't be embarrassed. It's buttoned up, these guys are good. Check out the details, there's a lot of great nuances from signage, photographs, sculptures, mirrors...

2. Food: 
There were 4 adults with us, and ordered the Goong Special ($145) which had so much good stuff with 9 meat items and plethora of wholesome side dishes. We had smiles and waving white flags after the meal. It just tasted so fresh. If you're gonna just have one thing, get the PRIME SHORT RIB (wow). Take a walk down the middle of the restaurant, you'll see the butcher actually slicing the meats. The quality is unlike any other Korean place in Vegas--even have the meat displayed and labeled--very proud to show you how fresh the meat looks. On the display when I was there was Rib Eye, Top Sirloin, and Chuck Flat--all of them Wagyu.

3. Service: 
Servers looked very smart with black unis. Just enough attention and polite when you ask them for things. One of my pet peeves is timing as in when plates need to be removed (hate having empty plates just meandering) and given this is a Korean restaurant with countless of plates on the table, they did a good job. 

----------------------------------------------

Listen up restauranteurs wanting to enter Rainbow Blvd--Goong should be your model as it challenges what a restaurant in "local" Vegas should be. You seriously can turn your place to something the community can be proud of and as Goong is in mine, they'll be seeing me a lot.
We ordered the Goong special at $145 that feeds 4-5. All 5 of us are pretty full! Delicious food, great service, beautiful and calming atmosphere. I'd come again :-)

I don't know where all the other Yelpers went but I went to this place last night (8/9/2017) and this place is not as good as Hobak. The portions are smaller but you get more side dishes. The interior of the restaurant looks amazing and the dishes/bowls that they use here are very nice too. However I find it very odd that they use those disposable chopsticks despite how nice other things are. 

The girl server was very nice and attentive. She asked us which meat we would prefer to grill first and let us eat at our own pace. However halfway through our meal they switched to a guy server and service started to go downhill. He didn't ask us which meat we wanted to grill first and he was grilling everything very fast and we felt rushed. There were like two table eating in the entire restaurant so I don't understand the need for him to rush us out.
Overall food tasted just okay/average/almost at the level you get at ayce places. I have tasted much better Korean bbq elsewhere. 

Now comes the worst part...I started to feel extremely sick at around 10-11pm that day. I had really bad watery diarrhea the entire night and had been throwing up until 4am. I felt really weak the next day and had to miss school. I had many exams that week and all I can say is I don't think i performed as well as I hoped. The diarrhea lasted around 3 days. 
I'm pretty sure I got food poisoning from this place because that's the only meal I ate that day.
